column1: LEX-FAOC149164;"Plan d’Action National pour la Lutte Contre la Désertification aux Comores PAN/LCD.";"L’Union des Comores a élaboré le présent Plan d’Action National de Lutte contre la Désertification (PAN)
column2: afin de se conformer au Plan-cadre décennal stratégique 2008-2018 qui a reformé la Convention des Nations Unies sur la Lutte contre la Désertification (CLD). Le présent PAN vise à atteindre les objectifs nationaux en matière de lutte contre la désertification et la dégradation des terres
column3: tout en étant cohérent avec les objectifs opérationnels du Plan décennal de la CLD
column4: lesquels objectifs doivent concourir à atteindre les 4 objectifs stratégiques suivants: a) améliorer les conditions de vie des populations touchées; b) améliorer l’état des écosystèmes touchés; c) dégager des avantages généraux d’une mise en œuvre efficace de la Convention; d) mobiliser des ressources en faveur de la mise en œuvre de la Convention par l’instauration de partenariats efficaces entre acteurs nationaux et internationaux. Les objectifs du Plan d’Action national ainsi que les résultats escomptés et les activités à réaliser pour les atteindre sont décrits dans le Chapitre 5.1. Les objectifs consistent à: 1) informer
column5: éduquer
column6: sensibiliser les acteurs nationaux et internationaux sur les questions liées à la désertification et la dégradation des terres aux Comores; 2) restaurer les terres dégradées et lutter contre l’érosion des sols
column7: en vue d’augmenter la productivité agricole; 3) promouvoir une gestion durable et participative des ressources forestières et de stopper ou atténuer la déforestation; 4) protéger les bassins versants et les ressources en eau; 5) renforcer les capacités et les connaissances techniques et scientifiques en matière de lutte contre la désertification et la dégradation des terres.Le Plan envisage de promouvoir une gestion durable et participative des ressources forestières et de stopper ou atténuer la défloration. A cet effet
column8: il préconise les activités suivantes: (i) appuyer
column9: accompagner la mise en place de boisements communautaires ou privés
column10: (ii) appuyer
column11: accompagner les activités en cours visant à créer des aires protégées terrestres dans les zones forestières
column12: (iii) former
column13: encadrer et accompagner les producteurs à pratiquer l’agroforesterie
column14: (iv) élaborer des guides techniques relatifs aux systèmes de production associant production vivrière et couverture forestière
column15: et les vulgariser auprès des paysans
column16: (v) restaurer les terres dégradées et lutter contre l’érosion des sols
column17: en vue d’augmenter la productivité agricole.S’agissant d’améliorer la résilience des moyens de subsistance face aux menaces et crises ayant des répercussions sur l’agriculture
column18: la nutrition et la sécurité alimentaire
column19: les activités suivantes sont envisagées par le Plan: (i) élaborer des plans d’aménagement pour les principaux bassins versants
column20: (ii) reboiser les têtes de sources et les berges des rivières avec des espèces qui favorisent l’écoulement
column21: en renforcement de la campagne nationale de reboisement lancée en 2012
column22: (iii) améliorer
column23: renforcer le cadre national de lutte contre la désertification et la dégradation des terres
column24: (iv) créer un système de collecte et de vulgarisation des informations relatives à l’évolution de l’état des terres agricoles aux Comores
column25: (v) renforcer les capacités et les connaissances techniques et scientifiques en matière de lutte contre la désertification et la dégradation des terres (vi) appuyer la mise en place d’un système de suivi de l’évolution du climat et d’alerte précoce sur phénomènes climatiques.Dans le cadre de la gouvernance
column26: la mise en œuvre de la Convention des Nations Unies pour la Lutte contre la Désertification est assurée par le Ministère en charge de l’agriculture
column27: de la pêche et de l’environnement. Celui-ci comprend en son sein la Direction Générale de l’Environnement et des Forêts
column28: la Direction Nationale des Stratégies Agricoles et de l’Élevage et les Centres Ruraux de Développement Économiques.

column1: LEX-FAOC150886;"Ninth Development Plan 2007-2013.";"The Ninth Development Plan is a national plan with a sectoral approach covering the period 2007–2013. The main objectives of the Plan are: a) increasing competitiveness
column2: b) increasing employment
column3: c) strengthening human development and social solidarity
column4: d) ensuring regional development
column5: e) increasing quality and effectiveness in public services. The Plan also aims at protecting the environment and improving urban infrastructure
column6: making agricultural structures more efficient and promoting the development of rural areas.Food security is among the specific objectives of the Plan. Special regard is given to maternal and infant health.The Plan also aims at making agriculture more productive and sustainable. The productivity per unit of livestock will be increased; fodder plant production will also be increased. Specific measures concern animal production
column7: cereals production
column8: organic agriculture. With respect to fisheries
column9: the Plan is focused on the sustainable exploitation of fishery resources (both marine and inland fisheries). Activities for researching
column10: protecting and utilizing the biological diversity and genetic resources of the country and for transforming them into economic value will be accelerated. Reforestation and agroforestry activities will be supported.The Plan also aims at eradicating rural poverty. Wirth a view to promoting development in rural areas
column11: a Rural Development Plan will be prepared. Priority will be given to issues such as strengthening producer organizations and making the education and dissemination activities effective. Contribution of producer organizations to training and extension services will be supported. Training and extension services in the use of pesticides
column12: fertilizers
column13: quality seeds
column14: irrigation
column15: plant and animal health
column16: as well as food hygiene will be increased. The participation of rural women in decision making process will be supported. Measures will be taken to prevent child labor in rural areas. Appropriate financing instruments addressing the needs of rural areas will be developed.Agricultural
column17: environmental and technological policies will be assessed in an integrated manner in order to minimize the risks related to biosecurity and genetically modified organisms. New policies will be developed in fundamental areas such as implementing modern irrigation techniques
column18: transition to competitive product types
column19: enhancing marketing opportunities
column20: and developing human resources and institutional capacities. The Plan aims at enabling more inclusive and efficient agricultural systems. The main principles include the sustainable and efficient use of soil resources through the use of highly productive agricultural fields for agricultural production purposes
column21: utilizing agricultural lands by making use of proper agricultural techniques as well as through land use planning. Irrigation investments and land consolidation will be expanded. Measures are envisaged to increase competitiveness in exports and modernize agricultural and food enterprises. Credit and subsidies are envisaged too.Regarding environmental protection
column22: the Plan recalls the polluter pays principle and provides for the adoption of a national plan for reducing greenhouse gas emissions.The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs is responsible for matters related to the production
column23: consumption and supervision of food products. A Plan Monitoring and Steering Committee will be set up to monitor and evaluate the implementation of the Ninth Development Plan.

column1: LEX-FAOC149367;"National Gender and Children Policy.";"The National Gender and Children Policy is a national multi-sectoral policy for Ghana which was developed by the Ministry of Women and Children’s Affairs with the objective to mainstream gender concerns in the national development process in order to improve the social
column2: civic
column3: economic and cultural conditions of the people of Ghana
column4: particularly women and children. Specific objectives of the Policy include: to redress imbalances which arise from existing gender inequalities through policy review
column5: legal reforms and enforcement of existing legislation; to provide a national framework from which policies are derived; to implement activities designed to strengthen women’s role in the economic development; to implement activities designed to promote children’s development and protection; to promote women’s equal access to
column6: and control over economically significant resources and benefits; and to enhance the survival
column7: development and protection of children.The District Assemblies have responsibility for managing and implementing specific programmes aimed at reducing poverty and ensuring the appropriate development and protection of the rights and welfare of the children. Critical areas of concern are agriculture
column8: health
column9: water and sanitation.The Policy addresses concerns related to women's access to land tenure and ownership. The Ministry of Women and Children’s Affairs (MOWAC) shall liaise with other institutions to pay attention to key gender concerns and related issues
column10: e.g. property ownership
column11: land tenure
column12: credit
column13: legal rights as well as relevant options for addressing them such as constitutional guarantees.The Ministry of Women and Children’s Affairs
column14: assisted by women and children focused organizations
column15: will lead the implementation of the Policy. The different governmental and non governmental stakeholders that will participate in the implementation of the Policy are listed under Section 8.

column1: LEX-FAOC053319;"Physical Planning Act 1989.";"Section 2 declares that all land in Papua New Guinea shall be subject to this Act. Section 4 defines matters primarily of national interest for the purposes of this Act. Where consideration is being given to a physical planning matter under this Act
column2: the appropriate authority shall take into account the provisions of the Environmental Planning Act 1978
column3: the Environmental Contaminants Act 1978
column4: and the Conservation Areas Act 1978 and other matters listed in section 5. The Minister may appoint a Chief Physical Planner for the purposes of this Act pursuant to section 6. The Chief Physical Planner is charged with the maintenance of standards of physical planning in the country and has such other powers
column5: functions
column6: duties and responsibilities as are prescribed. Duties of Minister responsible for physical planning are defined by section 7. A National Physical Planning Board is established under section 8. Functions of the Board are listed in section 17. Section17 to 33 provide for the establishment of Provincial Physical Planning Boards
column7: Local Physical Planning Boards and the National Capital District Physical Planning Board
column8: define their duties and powers and regulate their functioning. Section44 provides that a development plan may be prepared for any area in Papua New Guinea
column9: whether or not it is a physical planning area
column10: and may be: (a) a provincial development plan; or (b) an urban development plan; or (c) a local development plan; or (d) a subject development plan. Section 45 concerns contents of development plan. A development plan may designate land which may be required for public purposes as prescribed in the Land Act 1996. (sect. 56). The Minister may declare an area to be a physical planning area in the national interest under section 67 and a provincial Minister may declare an area within the province to be a physical planning area under section 68. Where a person intends to apply for a subdivision of land under Section 130 of the Land Act 1996 or a consolidation of leases under Section 131 of the Land Act 1996 for land within a physical planning area
column11: he or she shall first obtain planning permission under section 75. Section 82 provides for a Preservation of Trees Order to be made by a Board for the preservation of any trees in a physical planning area. The Papua New Guinea Physical Planning Appeals Tribunal is established for the purpose of hearing appeals under this Act (sect. 88). (106 sections divided into 12 Parts)

column2: by establishing rules on whether proof presented to the Cadastre Authority with regard to land registration may be processed without authorization; on certification of land deduction by acquisition of agricultural property; and on the establishment of an overview map. column1: LEX-FAOC032654;"Agreement of 1996 between the Russian Federation and the Krasnodar Territory regarding the delimitation of jurisdictional subjects and plenary powers between the State Bodies of the Russian Federation and the State Bodies of the Krasnodar Territory.";"Authorised representatives of the state bodies of state power of the Russian Federation and the bodies of state power of the Krasnodar Territory have agreed on the following: 1). The State Bodies of the Russian Federation and the State Bodies of the Krasnodar Territory jointly are authorized to: a). establish the conditions for economic activity and use of natural resources on the territory of the Krasnodar Territory pertaining to health resorts (spa) and recreational areas; b). establish special types of land tenure on the territory of the Krasnodar Territory
column2: ensuring conservation and rational use of the stock of land; 2). The following issues are within the jurisdiction of the Russian Federation and its State Bodies: a). elaboration with the participation of the State Bodies of the Krasnodar Territory of normative legal acts pertaining to the sphere specified in the paragraph 1; b). elaboration and validation with the participation of the State Bodies of the Krasnodar Territory long-term federal programs of social and economic development of the Krasnodar Territory
column3: including improvement of ecosystem of the coastline of the Black sea and the Azov sea and social and economic development of health resort (spa) zones. 3). The state bodies of the Krasnodar Territory
column4: for the purpose of implementation of the present Treaty
column5: shall participate in elaboration and realization of federal programs specified in the paragraph 2 of the present Treaty.

column1: LEX-FAOC151599;"Crown Forests Assets Act (No. 99 of 1989).";"This Act
column2: consisting of 5 Parts and three Schedules
column3: provides for the following aspects of forestry assets: management of the Crown’s forest assets; the transfer of those assets while at the same time protecting the claims of Maori under the Treaty of Waitangi Act 1975; in the case of successful claims by Maori under that Act
column4: the transfer of Crown forest land to Maori ownership and for payment by the Crown to Maori of compensation; and other incidental matters.It is divided into the following Parts: Crown forest land (I); Crown forestry assets and Crown forestry licences (II); Return of Crown forest land to Maori ownership and compensation (III); Amendments to Treaty of Waitangi Act 1975 (IV); Amendments of other Acts (V). The Schedules are divided as follows: Compensation payable to Maori (1); Maori owned land that is not Crown forest land (2); Initial term of Crown forestry licences (3).Schedule 1: Compensation payable to Maori; Schedule 2: Maori owned land that is not Crown forest land; Schedule 3: Initial term of Crown forestry licences. Interesting provisions as to protective covenants in all Crown forestry licences are contained in sections 18-23.

column1: LEX-FAOC156486;"Regional Law No. 16-OZ “On calculation of payment for consolidated land plots”.";"This Regional Law establishes the modalities of calculation of land charges for consolidated land plots
column2: pertaining to private ownership
column3: as a result of extension of land area dimension following redistribution of regional public land with public land with undelimited ownership. The amount of land charges shall be calculate by calculated by regional executive body in case of regional public land and by local government in case of municipal land. The amount of payment shall be calculated as difference between cadastre value of consolidated extended land area and cadastre value of private land area before consolidation.

column1: LEX-FAOC156484;"Regional Law No. 146-OZ “On allotment of plots of land in ownership to citizens free of charge”.";"This Regional Law sets forth the modalities of allotment of plots of land in ownership to citizens free of charge for gardening
column2: horticulture
column3: subsistence farming
column4: family farming and commercial farming
column5: to citizens with three children under age
column6: citizens with disabled children and specialists in agricultural professions with university degree under age of 35 years working in rural areas. It establishes also minimum and maximum agricultural land area of plots of land that can be allotted in ownership free of charge. Public and municipal land parcels can be transferred in ownership to citizens once-only for the following purposes: (a) gardening and horticulture; (b) farming; and (c) individual housing construction. Maximum land dimensions shall be established as follows: (a) for farming – 50ha; (b) for gardening – 0
column7: 2 ha; (c) for horticulture – 0
column8: 2ha; (d) for individual housing construction – 0
column9: 2ha; and (e) for subsistence farming – 0
column10: 2 ha.

column1: LEX-FAOC163555;"Action Plan for Implementing Forestry Policies and Strategies.";"The Action Plan is a national plan with a sectoral approach. The time frame of the Plan is 10 years between 2010 -2020. The objectives of the Plan are a) improvement of forest management; b) capacity building; c) protection of forests; d) forestry sector development; e) development of private sector.To increase forest production and to reduce the risks of forest production losses
column2: strong control mechanisms will be enforced
column3: environmental protection and forest management will be improved. The seedling production capacity will also be improved. Biodiversity will be protected by the establishment of an Action Plan and by the establishment of protected zones. The sustainable utilization of non-wood products such as forest fruits
column4: mushrooms
column5: medical and aromatic plants will be ensured.Thinning and tending activities will provide development opportunities in rural areas. In addition
column6: the use of non-wood forest products will be enhanced to create incomes for the rural population. Forest owner associations will be supported.Research and monitoring regarding forest health
column7: environment and non-wood products will be promoted and forestry education will be improved. Forestry education will consist of forest vocational education
column8: forest vocational training and higher forest education. Awareness campaigns will be held for promoting the importance of forestry. A plantation program will be established to calculate areas suitable for planting and to select most appropriate species and provinces. Pre-commercial and commercial thinning will be done in young forests which will lead to small scale industry development. The development of the private sector will be enhanced. Privatization of Socially Owned Enterprises will be promoted. Privately owned wood processing sector will be supported. Private investment in bioenergy production will be promoted. A land consolidation process that may include sale of public forest lands will be initiated. Regarding harvesting and transport
column9: the equipment and technology will be renewed and modernized
column10: the licensing system will reviewed and the road network will be improved.The Ministry of Agriculture
column11: Forestry and Rural Development will be the main implementer of the Plan. Other ministries to be involved in the implementation of the Plan are: Ministry of Economy and Finance
column12: Ministry of Environment and Spatial Planning
column13: Ministry of Education
column14: Science and Technology
column15: Ministry of Trade and Industry
column16: Ministry of Labour and Social Welfare. The capacity and power of the institutions responsible for the protection forests and environment will be strengthened and new legislation on non-wood products will be drafted.

column1: LEX-FAOC042440;"Inheritance Act
column2: 2002 (Cap. 116).";"With regard to the real and personal estate of every person dying after the commencement of this Act
column3: there shall be abolished: (a) all existing modes
column4: rules and canons of descent
column5: and of devolution by special occupancy or otherwise
column7: or of personal estate; (b) tenancy by the curtesy; (c) dower. The residuary estate of an intestate shall he distributed in the manner mentioned in section 4. Where under this Part the residuary estate of an intestate or any part thereof devolves upon or is directed to be distributed among the issue of the intestate such residuary estate or part thereof shall be distributed in equal shares
column8: if more than one
column9: among all or any of the issue of the intestate living at the death of the intestate and among all or any of the issue living at the death of the intestate of any issue of the intestate who predeceases the intestate
column10: such issue to take through all degrees
column11: according to their stocks in equal shares if more than one
column12: the share which their parent would have taken if living at the death of the intestate
column13: and so that no issue shall take whose parent is living at the death of the intestate and so capable of taking.

column1: LEX-FAOC023899;"Joint Order No. 525/67 of 1995 of the Ministry of Environmental Protection and of the Federal Committee on Land Resources and Land Survey regarding the validation of the Fundamental Regulations on re-cultivation of land
column2: removal
column3: conservation and rational use of the fertile layer of soil.";"This Joint Order puts into effect the Fundamental Regulations
column4: previously approved by the Ministry of Agricultural Products and other Federal Executive Bodies concerned. The document consists of V Parts. Part I lays down the general provisions. Part II deals with the modalities of issuing licences for earth-moving economic activity that may damage topsoil. Part III determines the modalities of formal acceptance and transfer of re-cultivated land. Part IV regards registration of the damaged land. Part V concerns control over re-cultivated land and establishes the liability for the infringement of the regulations on re-cultivation of land. The document contains 6 Annexes.

column1: LEX-FAOC151114;"Loi n° 2004-018 du 22 juillet 2004 fixant les règles applicables aux communes.";"La présente loi fixe les règles applicables aux communes
column2: collectivités territoriales décentralisées de base
column3: créées par décret du président de la République
column4: conformément aux dispositions de la loi d'orientation de la décentralisation.La commune a une mission générale de développement local et d'amélioration du cadre et des conditions de vie de ses habitants. Diverses compétences sont transférées par l’Etat aux communes
column5: notamment la promotion des activités de production agricoles
column7: et piscicoles d'intérêt ; la construction
column8: l'équipement
column9: la gestion et l'entretien des marchés
column10: et abattoirs ; l'alimentation en eau potable ; la protection des ressources en eaux souterraines et superficielles; l'élaboration de plans communaux d'action pour l’environnement; la lutte contre l'insalubrité
column11: les pollutions et les nuisances; la gestion des ordures ménagères.Par ailleurs
column12: elles sont compétentes en matière de planification
column13: l'aménagement du territoire
column14: l'urbanisme ; et de la gestion et de l'utilisation du domaine public maritime et fluvial.

column1: LEX-FAOC151115;"Loi n° 2004-019 du 22 juillet 2004 fixant les règles applicables aux régions.";"La présente loi fixe les règles applicables aux régions
column2: collectivité territoriale décentralisée constituée de plusieurs départements
column3: conformément aux dispositions de la loi d'orientation de la décentralisation.Diverses compétences sont transférées par l’ Etat aux régions
column4: notamment la promotion des activités agricoles
column5: pastorales et piscicoles; la gestion de l'environnement et des ressources naturelles (l'élaboration de plans régionaux spécifiques d'intervention d'urgence et de prévention des risques
column6: la mise en défens et autres mesures locales de protection de la nature;la gestion des eaux d'intérêt régional;la création de bois
column7: forêts et zones protégés d'intérêt régional suivant un plan dûment approuvé par le représentant de l'Etat;la réalisation de pare-feu et la mise à feu précoce
column8: dans le cadre de la lutte contre les feux de brousse;la gestion des parcs naturels régionaux
column9: suivant un plan soumis à l'approbation du représentant de l'Etat; l'élaboration
column10: la mise en œuvre et le suivi des plans ou schémas régionaux d'action pour l'environnement); la planification
column11: l'aménagement du territoire
column12: l'urbanisme.Les organes de gestion de la région sont le conseil régional; et le président du conseil régional.

column1: LEX-FAOC012888;"Décret du 11 juillet 1960 portant le régime foncier.";"Ce décret porte régime foncier au Rwanda. Il est formé par 20 articles répartis en 4 chapitres
column2: à savoir: Substitution des pouvoirs en matière de cession et de concession de terres domaniales (I); Constatation et rachat des droit coutumiers (II); Octroi de la propriété immobiière individuelle aux occupants coutumiers et aux détenteurs d'un droit d'occupation du sol (III); Dispositions générales (IV). Ce décret prévoit le passage des pouvoirs détenus par le résident général en matière de concession et de cession des terres domaniales au gouvernement
column3: qui fixera aussi les règlements et les tarifications relatifs aux cessions et aux concessions. Toute cession ou concession est subordonnée à une enquête visant à constater la nature et l'étendue des droits coutumiers dont ces terres seraient éventuellement grevées
column4: qui ne peuvent être cédées sans le consentement du détenteur. Les détenteurs d'un droit d'occupation du sol et les occupants coutumiers peuvent obtenir la propriété de ces terres en adressant une requête au conservateur des titres fonciers
column5: habilité à leur délivrer le certificat d'enregistrement.

column1: LEX-FAOC060546;"Agricultural Finance Act [Chapter 18:02].";"This Act establishes the Agricultural Finance Corporation. The Corporation shall carry out the following functions: (a) subject to such terms and conditions as the Board of the Corporation may impose
column2: make advances: (i) to any person for any purpose connected with the production
column3: processing
column4: storage
column5: packing or marketing of any produce obtained from agriculture or any operations relating to agriculture
column6: including: A. the acquisition of land; B. the conservation or control of soil or water; (ii) to any cooperative agricultural company or cooperative society for a purpose referred to in subparagraph (i); (iii) to any association
column7: union
column8: society or other such body of persons for a purpose which
column9: in the opinion of the Board
column10: is likely to be of assistance or benefit to members of the farming community or any industry connected with agriculture; (b) in accordance with any Scheme
column11: to render assistance to persons engaged in or about to engage in agriculture; (c) subject to the Banking Act [Chapter 24:20]
column12: to carry on the business of a commercial bank; (c) generally
column13: to perform any other function which the Corporation is authorized to perform by its memorandum of association or by any other enactment. Designated property purchased by borrower
column14: e.g. livestock
column15: may become Corporation property (sect. 41). The Act also provides for land as security. The Minister may
column16: with the approval of the Minister responsible for finance and after consultation with the Board
column17: establish any scheme for the provision of assistance to persons engaged or about to engage in agriculture (sect. 50). An Agricultural Finance Scheme is set out in the Third Schedule. Regulation-making powers of the Minister are defined in section 64. Section 65 prescribes offences and penalties. (65 sections completed by 3 Schedules)

column1: LEX-FAOC095291;"Decreto Nº 700/2010 - Créase la Comisión de Análisis e Instrumentación de la Propiedad Comunitaria Indígena.";"El presente Decreto establece
column2: en el ámbito del Instituto Nacional de Asuntos Indígenas
column3: la Comisión de Análisis e Instrumentación de la Propiedad Comunitaria Indígena. Entre sus objetivos cabe destacar los siguientes: a) elevar al Ejecutivo Nacional una propuesta normativa para instrumentar un procedimiento que efectivice la garantía constitucional del reconocimiento de la posesión y propiedad comunitaria indígena; b) evaluar la implementación del Relevamiento Territorial de Comunidades Indígenas.

column1: LEX-FAOC151939;"Regulation on conditions for the introduction of sewage into water or soil and on the list of substances particularly harmful to water environment.";"This Regulation of the Minister of Environment
column2: which is composed of 30 articles and 12 Annexes
column3: lays down: (1) the substances particularly harmful to water environment
column4: causing pollution that should be eliminated
column5: and the substances that are particularly harmful to water environment
column6: causing pollution which should be limited; (2) conditions to be met for the introduction of sewage into water or soil
column7: including maximum values of pollution
column8: and the conditions to be met for the agricultural use of sewage; (3) the place and the minimum frequency of sampling sewage
column9: reference methodology of analysis and the method to assess if sewage meets the required conditions; (4) the maximum values of pollutants in waste water from sewage treatment plants.

column1: LEX-FAOC008962;"Restitution of Land Rights Act (No. 22 of 1994).";"Persons or communities contemplated in section 121(2) of the Constitution are entitled to enforce restitution of a right in land (sect. 2). A person shall be entitled to claim title in land if the claimant
column2: or his
column3: her or its antecedents was prevented from obtaining or retaining title in the claimed land because of a racially discriminatory laws
column4: and if the claimant proves that the registered owner of the claimed land holds title as a result of a transaction between such registered owner or his
column5: her or its antecedents and the claimant or his
column7: or its antecedents
column8: in terms of which such registered owner or his
column9: her or its antecedents held the land on behalf of the claimant or his
column10: her or its antecedents (sect. 3). Chapter II provides for the establishment of a Commission for the restitution of land rights consisting of Land Claims Commissioners (sect. 4). The Commission shall prepare hearings of claims by the Court and advise and assist claimants in preparation and submission of the claims (sect. 6). Chapter II provides also rules with respect to the procedure of lodgement of claims
column11: the Commission's power of investigation
column12: mediation by a mediator appointed by the Chief Land Commissioner
column13: a certificate of feasibility of restitution
column14: and various other matters relating to activities of the Commission. Chapter III provides for the establishment of a Land Claims Court and regulated various matters relating to the Court and court proceedings. Chapter IV contains miscellaneous provisions.

column1: LEX-FAOC151687;"Building Law.";"The present Law implements the Federal Land Use Planning Law of 22 June 1979 and is the basis for measures concerning land use planning and building of the Canton and municipalities. The Law aims at a purposeful
column2: especially thrifty use of land; the promotion of a meaningful and orderly development of the settlement; the protection of cultural heritage
column3: landscapes and natural resources from impairment. The text consists of 94 articles divided into 4 chapters as follows: General provisions (I); Planning law (II); Building regulations (III); Final provisions (IV).

column1: LEX-FAOC008965;"Land Reform (Labour Tenants) Act 1996 (No. 3 of 1996).";"""Labour tenant"" is defined in section 1 as a person who: (a) is residing or has the right to reside on a farm; (b) who has or has had the right to use cropping or grazing land on the farm
column2: referred to in paragraph (a)
column3: or another farm of the owner
column4: and in consideration of such right provides or has provided labour to the owner or the lessee; (c) whose parent or grandparent resided or resides on a farm and had the use of cropping or grazing land on such farm or another farm of the owner
column5: and in consideration of such right provides labour to the owner or the lessee of such or such other farm
column6: including a person who has been appointed successor to a labour tenant in accordance with the provisions of section 3(4) and (5)
column7: but excluding a farmworker. Provisions of Chapter II confirm the right of labour tenants to occupy and use land which was either held by him or her on 2 June 1995 or the occupation and use of which is restored to him or her in terms of this Act or any other law (sect. 3). Other provisions of this Chapter concern eviction of labour tenants and other persons and reinstatement or labour tenants by Court Order. Chapter III provides for the acquisition of ownership or other rights in land by a labour tenant and related procedures of arbitration or court proceedings. Chapter contains provisions concerning the Land Claims Court and Arbitrators; Chapter V contains miscellaneous provisions.

column1: LEX-FAOC149900;"Regional Law No. 1867-OZ “On public control”.";"This Regional Law establishes the modalities of organization and performance of public control as a form of public participation. It shall not be applicable to elections and referendum. Regional executive bodies shall have the following plenary powers: (a) formation of advisory councils at the regional executive bodies; (b) examination of final documents drafted by public control bodies; and (c) consideration of proposals
column2: recommendations and conclusions contained in the final documents. Public control shall be performed by the Public (Civic) Chambers
column3: advisory councils at the regional executive bodies and local government
column4: public inspections and public control groups. Public control can initiate public hearings
column5: obtain results of inspections performed by regional and municipal executive bodies and participate at joint supervisory (control) arrangements.

column1: LEX-FAOC012868;"Loi nº 11/82 sur la protection
column2: la conservation et l'utilisation des sols.";"Cette loi fixe les mesures principales en matière de conservation
column3: de protection et d'utilisation des sols. Tout exploitant doit: créer et entretenir des dispositifs de lutte contre l'érosion hydrique ou éolienne et éviter et éviter toute dégradation anthropique; maintenir et améliorer la fertilité des sols; pratiquer des méthodes culturales ne dégradant pas le sol; éviter la dégradation des pâturages. Des mesures de conservation et de protection doivent être prises aussi par les responsables des travaux d'entretien des routes et par les exploitants des mines et des carrières. Parmi les mesures de protection
column4: la loi prévoit spécifiquement le reboisement des terres dégradées impropres à l'agriculture et de l'élevage ainsi que l'interdiction des feux de brousse et incendies non autorisés. L'article 6 prévoit la création
column5: au niveau de chaque Préfecture
column6: d'une Commission chargée de donner son avis technique et d'assurer le contrôle et le suivi des mesures prescrittes par la loi en matière de conservation
column7: protection et utilisation des sols. La loi porte aussi les sanctions prévues pour les infractions aux dispositions de la loi même.

column1: LEX-FAOC098698;"Government Regulation RI No. 11/2010 concerning the control and utilization of neglected land.";"This Government Regulation provides for the prevention
column2: orderly control and utilization of neglected land.Neglected land will cover land which was granted the right by the State in the form of Ownership Right
column3: Right to Use for Business
column4: Right to Construct Building
column5: Right to Use and Right to Manage
column6: and that has not been exploited
column7: used or managed according to the conditions set out by the State.The Regulation states that neglected land shall be utilized by the State to run the national development program
column8: particularly in the agrarian sector.

column1: LEX-FAOC159685;"Law on Assignment and Reclamation of Lands in Islamic Republic of Iran.";"The purpose of this Act is to regulate provisions regarding transfer of lands to individuals in order to make efficient use of water and fertile soil
column2: as well as leading the country to self-sufficiency. In particular
column3: it should be noted that rights of the people on fruitful lands should be respected. Exploitation of the natural woods and forests are exclusive rights of the Government. The Government may assign abandoned lands to individuals for agricultural purpose. Indigenous people and persons with knowledge in agriculture are considered as a priority. The Act consists of 26 articles
column4: subdivided in 6 Chapters: Definitions (I); Fruitful Lands (II); National Natural Resources (III); Transferable Lands (IV); Transfer Arrangements and Conditions (V); Miscellaneous Provisions (VI).

column1: LEX-FAOC099500;"Governmental Decree No. 338 of 2006 concerning land offices
column2: the Institute of Geodesy
column3: Cartography and Remote Sensing
column4: the Geographical Names Committee and detailed rules of real estate registration proceedings.";"This Decree establishes that the competent authority for real estate issues is the countrywide network system of land offices (territorial and local offices). They are responsible for registration of legal transactions
column5: cadastral mapping changes and dealing with land and other real estate property-related activities. The Hungarian Land Register is owned and maintained by the Ministry of Rural Development. This Decree establishes also the Institute of Geodesy
column6: Cartography and Remote Sensing as the institutional body for land surveying and geo-information. The duties of land offices and the Institute of Geodesy
column7: Cartography and Remote Sensing are of a multipurpose nature. They include: reference framing and mapping
column8: and land and real estate property-related activities
column9: in close correlation with the unified land registry; registration of legal changes to rights in land and real estate properties; maintenance of the digital land registry; maintenance of digital cadastral maps
column10: quality control of cadastral mapping
column11: a data service of legal and mapping information on properties at land offices
column12: and supplying this data via to the electronic network; land lease registration; protection of agricultural land; digital elevation model services; maintenance of the geographical database; topographic mapping and services for referencing spatial data; maintenance of administrative boundaries (including the permanent state boundary); IT and mapping support of the EU agricultural subsidy system in Hungary
column13: and so on. Land offices provide legal and cadastral mapping information
column14: data and other services to external users and citizens generally for a fee. Annex 1 to this Decree determines the territorial competence of land offices.

column1: LEX-FAOC124720;"Decree laying down details on a preliminary assessment of flood risk.";"This Decree of the Ministry of Environment
column2: which is composed of six articles and four Annexes
column3: provides details on a preliminary assessment of flood risk
column4: review and update of this assessment. Basis for the preparation of a preliminary assessment of flood risk are: (a) summary reports on floods
column5: their consequences and taken measures; (b) the interim report on the flood situation; (c) records on observations of water levels in water stations; (d) measuring rainfall precipitation and information about water in the period before the flood and during flood; (e) flood plans; (f) Water Plan of Slovakia and river basin management plans; (g) scientific and technical projects
column7: studies and hydrogeological surveys; (h) regional climate change scenarios for Slovakia; (i) landscaping projects; (j) land use plans for regions
column8: cities and areas
column9: (k) programs for forests; (l) other materials and documents which may be useful for preliminary flood risk assessment.

column1: LEX-FAOC157377;"Regional Decree No. 257-p “On the modalities of performance of municipal land control”.";"This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of performance of municipal land control by local government. Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs. The subject of inspection shall be checking data and information contained in the documentation related to land tenure. The scope of inspection shall be to control compliance by land tenant with compulsory legislative requirements related to land tenure with a view of prevention and suppression of unauthorized transactions with land. Municipal land control shall be performed in accordance with the annual plans. The outcome of municipal land control shall be legalized in the form of inspection certificate.

column2: conclusion

column4: allotment of land plots of 1 ha and over for construction
column5: decision-making related to auction sale of the rights of land lease and determination of authorized state land institution.

column1: LEX-FAOC094763;"Land and Conveyancing Law Reform Act 2009 (No. 27 of 2009).";"This Act provides for a comprehensive reform and modernization of land law and conveyancing law. It
column2: among other things
column3: provides for a simplification of the conveyancing process
column4: especially the procedures involved and the taking of security over land; facilitates extension of the registration of title system with a view to promoting its use; and facilitates the introduction of an electronic conveyancing system. The Act concerns also land ownership rights and abolition of feudal tenure and introduces ""fee farm grants"" a new form of tenure that confuses the nature of a freehold (without a rent) estate and leasehold (with a rent) estate.

column1: LEX-FAOC089736;"Landfill Tax (Amendment) Regulations 2009 (S.I. No. 1930 of 2009).";"These Regulations amend the Landfill Tax Regulations 1996: by revoking Part IX which relates to temporary disposals of material on a landfill site; and introduce a new requirement to give information and keep records in relation to information areas and authorize Revenue and Customs officers to require a person to designate a part of landfill site which will be an information area. Material on a landfill site which is not going to be disposed of as waste must be deposited in an information area where the Commissioners
column2: or their officers
column3: consider that the revenue is at risk. Once material is in an information area
column4: a record must be maintained in relation to it containing the information detailed in regulation 16A(4) of the Principal Regulations which should enable the Commissioners to clarify the taxable status of the material. Other amendments concern classification of prescribed activities as disposals subject to landfill tax.

column1: LEX-FAOC158536;"Law No. 267-V “On pastures and grazing”.";"This Law establishes legal
column2: economic and organizational grounds for sustainable management of pastures and regulates relations concerning rational management and protection of pastures
column3: improvement of ecological
column4: economic and resource potential thereof. Basic principles of the national legislation on pastures shall be as follows: (a) rational management and improvement of pastures; (b) protection of pastures and grazing grounds; (c) availability and accessibility of pastures for legal and natural persons; (d) subsidies and incentives for rational management and improvement of pastures; (e) control over management of pastures; (f) rate setting in the sphere of management and protection of pastures; (g) compensation for damages caused to pastures; and (h) liability for the infringement of the national legislation on pastures.

column1: LEX-FAOC158539;"Law No. 2807-IV “On provision of public services and amenities in urban areas”.";"This Law shall be applicable to land-use planning
column2: drainage
column3: land reclamation
column4: planting of trees and shrubbery
column5: noise reduction and other arrangements in urban areas. Local government shall be responsible for: (a) ensuring peace and quiet
column6: cleanliness and order in public urban areas; (b) organization of recreational areas for the population in urban areas; (c) establishment of the amount of compensation by legal and natural persons for environmental pollution in urban areas; and (d) public participation in provision of public services and amenities in urban areas. Recreational forests in urban areas shall be considered amenities provided by public administration. This Law establishes rights and duties of citizens in relation to access and use of public services and amenities in urban areas.

column1: LEX-FAOC009140;"Decreto Supremo Nº 001/94/AG - Reglamento de organización y funciones del Proyecto Nacional de Manejo de Cuencas Hidrográficas y Conservación de Suelos (PRONAMACHCS).";"El Reglamento de organización y funciones del Proyecto Nacional de Manejo de Cuencas Hidrográficas y Conservación de Suelos (PRONAMACHCS) consta de 4 títulos
column2: 20 artículos
column3: 2 disposiciones complementarias y 1 transitoria. INDICE: Disposiciones generales (I); Objetivo y finalidad (II); Organización y funciones (III); Organos desconcentrados (IV).El objetivo de PRONAMACHCS es diseñar
column4: promover y ejecutar estrategias y acciones técnico-administrativas y de gestión para el manejo integral de cuencas hidrográficas mediante la conservación de suelos
column5: reforestación e infraestructura rural
column6: con el fin de proteger y aprovechar racionalmente los recursos naturales renovables
column7: humanos y de capital de las zonas altoandinas (art. 4º).

column1: LEX-FAOC018621;"Mountain Catchment Areas Act.";"This Act makes provision for the conservation
column2: use
column3: management and control of land situated in mountain catchment areas. ""Mountain catchment area"" means any area declared by the Minister or competent authorities of provinces under section 2 to be a mountain catchment area. The Minister may issue directions with reference to land in mountain catchment areas
column4: relating to: (a) the conservation
column5: use
column6: management and control of such land; (b) the prevention of soil erosion
column7: the protection and treatment of the natural vegetation and the destruction of vegetation which is
column8: in the opinion of the Minister
column9: intruding vegetation; and (c) any other matter which he considers necessary or expedient for the achievement of the objects of this Act in respect of such land; and in reference to areas or land within five kilometers of the boundary of such mountain catchment areas directions relating to the destruction of vegetation which is
column10: in the opinion of the Minister
column11: intruding vegetation. The Minister may in respect of any mountain catchment area establish an advisory committee to advise him in relation to matters referred to in this Act. Remaining sections of this Act provide for fire protection plans for areas concerned and the powers of enforcement and implementation and prescribe offences and penalties.

column1: LEX-FAOC018625;"National Parks Act.";"This Act in its revised edition deals with the declaration of national parks
column2: the Nationals Parks Board and other wildlife institution
column3: regulates hunting and provised for rights relating to water of certain owners and occupiers of land in parks. The Minister may by notice in the Gazette declare various kind of State land to be a park under a name to be assigned to it in that notice
column4: and amend Schedule 1 by the addition of the name and a description of the land thus declared to be a park (sect. 2A and B). The Nationals Parks Board shall keep a register of land declared to be a park or declared to be a part of a park or excluded from a park under subsection (1)
column5: and such register shall contain the particulars as outlined in section 2B. There is established a fund to be known as the National Parks Land Acquisition Fund (sect. 12). (32 sections completed by 4 Schedules)

column1: LEX-FAOC149943;"Pakistan in the 21st Century - Vision 2030.";"This document is a national policy with a cross-sectoral approach. The main objectives of the Vision are: a) eradicating extreme poverty and hunger; b) achieving universal primary education; c) promoting gender equality and women empowerment; d) reducing child mortality; e) improving maternal health; f) combating HIV/aids
column2: malaria and other diseases; g) ensuring environmental sustainability; and h) developing a global partnership for development. Plants and animal types as well as farming systeFood security for all is one of the objectives to be attained (Chapter 6.5). Food security will be ensured through: a) enabling a competitive and sustainable agricultural sector; b) improving the nutritional quality of staple foods; c) finding solutions to the negative effect of declining water resources and land degradation on food security; d) providing safe drinking water; e) improving health care systems; f) ensuring household food security.The document aims at making agriculture more productive and sustainable Importance will be given to major agricultural products such as food
column3: feed
column4: fiber
column5: sugar
column7: meat
column8: milk
column9: poultry and fish. The output of several crops
column10: pulses
column11: oilseeds
column12: horticulture
column13: livestock and fisheries will be doubled. Diversification into high value agriculture and value added products will be ensured. In addition to the crop sector
column14: the production of food
column15: fiber and animal feed will be increased by the use of biotechnology. Biotechnology will also be used in developing genetically improved animals for milk or meat production and will be used for developing drought tolerant crop varieties. Market oriented livestock farming will be promoted. The Vision further focuses on the importance of managing land and water resources in a sustainable manner. Measures will be taken to ensure the sustainable management and protection of environment. An integrated water resource management strategy will be adopted to ensure the most optimal use of water and to enhance water efficiency. In addition
column16: the storage capacity will be increased and other water saving technologies such as laser land levelling
column17: furrow irrigation and high efficiency irrigation systems will be introduced. Blackish water will be used for agriculture. ms less vulnerable to climatic changes will be developed. Drought and flood resistant crop varieties will be promoted. Rangelands
column18: forests
column19: biodiversity will be protected from climatic changes by launching protection programs and increasing forested areas. The capacity building will be done regarding climate forecasting and analysis of its socio-economic impact.The Vision sets forth a cross-sectoral approach in reducing rural poverty. The living standards of the rural population will be improved through increasing agricultural production and mobilizing small farmers. Small scale farmers will be mobilized through making available key inputs such as special credit
column20: certified seed training
column21: small farm equipment
column22: veterinary coverage for livestock. A special fund will be established for financing operations by local communities through village organizations and farmers’ schools. Employment and income generation will be ensured and opportunities will be provided through diversification of the rural economy towards agro-based industries such as livestock
column23: fisheries and poultry. Initiatives will be launched to improve the skills and technology for reducing poverty and empowering women. Technical and financial assistance will be given to fishing communities. Community organizations and associations will be developed.The Vision also aims at enabling more inclusive and efficient agricultural and food systems. The competitiveness of the agricultural systems will be strengthened by adopting Good Agricultural Practices (GAP) and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP). Standards will be set for agricultural commodities from Pakistan to create more opportunities of export. Private sector-led growth will be ensured by promoting investments in value added products for domestic and export markets such as floriculture. The market systems for perishable commodities will be improved. Investment in transport and preservation technologies will be promoted. Measures for developing the rural infrastructure are envisaged too. The structural transformation of agriculture from small scale to commercialized agriculture will be ensured and the non-farm sector including agro-processing will be enhanced. Market development including input
column24: output and rural financial markets will be intensified. The asset ownership of small farmers will be enhanced by improving access to land
column25: water and livestock. The institutional and legal changes will be done regarding the ownership
column26: supply and use of water. Public investment will be done in rural infrastructure and institutions including water management
column27: research
column28: extension and education. Importance will be given to the issue of land division through inheritance. Special attention will be given to reduce the loss of fertile land to urbanization. Animal health coverage will be improved. Measures will be taken and control will be ensured regarding invasive pathogens imported with food
column31: livestock and germplasm. Post-harvest losses and bad hygienic conditions in fisheries sector will be addressed to improve the marketability of fish products.

column1: LEX-FAOC152340;"Décret n°2011-836-P-RM du 22 Décembre 2011  portant approbation du Schéma Directeur d’Urbanisme de la ville de Siby et environs.";"Le présent décret approuve et rend exécutoire pour une durée de vingt (20) ans
column3: le Schéma Directeur d’Urbanisme de la ville de Siby et environs.L’application du présent Schéma Directeur fera l’objet d’études de Plans d’Urbanisme Sectoriels (P.U. S.) et de plans de détails selon la programmation prévue dans le document. Ces plans ne peuvent modifier les grandes orientations du Schéma Directeur d’Urbanisme. Le Schéma Directeur d’Urbanisme ainsi approuvé est révisable tous les cinq (05) ans selon les exigences du développement social et économique de la ville de Siby et environs.

column1: LEX-FAOC086916;"Decision No. 17/2009/QD-TTg approving the master plan on socio-economic development of Tien Giang province till 2020.";"This Decision approves the master plan on the socio-economic development of Tien Giang province.This plan aims at developing the economy in a sustainable manner; raising competitiveness of local commodities and services and striving for an industry-service agriculture economic structure; contributing to the development of the Mekong River delta region; raising the people’s living standards; and protecting the ecological environment.The main objectives of the plan include: development of agriculture
column2: forestry and fishery; rational use of natural resources and treatment and control of environmental pollution; development of water supply
column3: drainage and irrigation systems; and land use and urban planning.

column1: LEX-FAOC098328;"Decree No. 61/2010/ND-CP on incentive policies for enterprises investing in agriculture and rural areas.";"This Decree provides a number of incentives and additional investment supports of the State for enterprises investing in agriculture and rural areas.The Decree specifies the incentives which investors are eligible for and include: land use levy exemption and reduction; land and water surface rent exemption and deduction; and land and water surface rent support for households and individuals. Investment supports include: human resource training supports; market development supports; consultancy service supports; and science and technology supports.The Decree further contains a list of agricultural subsectors eligible for special investment incentives.

column1: LEX-FAOC096981;"Action Programme for Nitrate Vulnerable Zones (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2009 (S.S.I. No. 447 of 2009).";"These Regulations amend the Action Programme for Nitrate Vulnerable Zones (Scotland) Regulations 2008 so as to implement Commission Decision 2009/431/EC granting derogation to England
column2: Scotland and Wales pursuant to Council Directive 91/676/EEC concerning the protection of waters against pollution caused by nitrates from agricultural sources.The Regulations provide for a derogation from the annual farm limit of nitrogen in livestock manure which may be obtained from the Scottish Ministers by an occupier of any grassland farm within a nitrate vulnerable zone. The Regulations set out application requirements and define obligations of an occupier who has obtained a derogation including record-keeping.

column1: LEX-FAOC013979;"Action Programme for Nitrate Vulnerable Zones (England and Wales) Regulations 1998 (S.I. no. 1202 of 1998).";"By establishing an action programme for nitrate vulnerable zones these Regulation implement
column2: as regards England and Wales
column3: the requirement in this respect as laid down in article 5 of Council Directive 91/676/EC concerning the protection of waters against pollution by nitrates from agricultural sources. Regulation 3 requires an occupier of a farm or livestock unit comprising all or part of a nitrate vulnerable zone to ensure that the action programme set out in the Schedule is implemented. They also provide for monitoring of the action programme (reg. 6)
column4: notices to be served requiring remedial action
column5: and a procedure of appeal against such notices. Breaches of some of these regulations are made criminal offences. The action plan concerns the use of nitrogen fertilizer
column6: chemical fertilizer in general and organic manure. As a general rule the application on land of nitrogen fertilizer shall take into account local environment factors such as soil conditions
column7: climatic conditions
column8: land use and agricultural practice.

column1: LEX-FAOC097452;"Mines and Minerals Act
column2: 2009 (No. 12 of 2009).";"This Act provides rules relative to the exploration for and the exploitation of mineral resources and related matters such as the protection of the environment and the use of water resources. It also contains special provisions relating to radioactive minerals.The Minister responsible for mineral resources shall be the principal administration authority for purposes of this Act and the Director of Mines shall be responsible for the implementation of this Act. Some powers are assigned to the Director of Geological Survey. The Minerals Advisory Board
column3: established under this Act
column4: shall advise the Minister on mining and related protection of the environment.The Act places restrictions on the use of land by the holder of a mineral right. The owner or lawful occupier of any land shall retain the right to graze stock upon or to cultivate the surface of such land. The Minister may compulsorily acquire private land or rights over or under private land for use by the holder of a large-scale mining licence. The Director shall establish and maintain a Mining Cadastre. Holders of mining rights may utilize the water and timber as necessary for mining operations. Dredging for minerals requires a special permit from the Minister.In addition to any requirements set out in the Environment Protection Act
column5: an environmental impact assessment shall be prepared by a small-scale or large-scale mining licence applicant.

column1: LEX-FAOC159492;"Decree No. 428 of the Council of Ministers validating the Regulation on general improvement of the territory and landscaping.";"This Decree establishes the criteria for general improvement of the territory and landscaping
column2: in particular urban land and land of inhabited residential areas
column3: as a form of land-use planning. It establishes that territory must be kept clean
column4: free of waste
column5: and have recreational areas and recreational waterbodies for the benefit of the population. Protected areas must have recreational areas with available wood-fired grills (barbecue).

column1: LEX-FAOC010006;"Expropriation Amendment Act (Act No. 45 of 1992).";"This Act amends certain definitions and expressions of the 1975 Expropriation Act; it extends the power to expropriate to any minister responsible for the administration of works and land affairs; restricts expropriation by Transnet to expropriation under the Legal Succession to the South African Transport Services Act of 1989; facilitates the expropriation procedure; extends payment of compensation in respect of unregistered rights; extends penal provisions; further regulates offers and claims relating to compensation
column2: disposal of the amount of compensation
column3: payment of interest
column4: of legal costs and the withdrawal of expropriation; repeals certain obsolete provisions; amends the Water Act
column5: 1956; amends the Deeds Registries Act
column7: so as to facilitate the recording of expropriation; amends the Legal Succession to the South African Transport Services Act of 1989; and provides for matters connected therewith.

column1: LEX-FAOC014017;"Decree relative to communications pursuant to the Pollution Act (No. 1327 of 1983).";"This Decree of the Ministry of Environment provides for the communication of projects and operations which may cause acute or substantial pollution problems. All operations listed in section 3 shall be communicated to the State Pollution Supervision and Control Agency. They include production of pesticides and chemical fertilizer (urea). Communication of plans or operations shall include information specified in section 3. Risk assessment and information regarding pollutant contents shall be included in the communication. column1: LEX-FAOC156469;"Slopeland Conservation and Utilization Act.";"This Act governs the conservation and utilization of slopeland.Article 3 provides for the definition of slopeland. Public slopeland which has not been subject to cadastral survey or general land registration shall be subject to regular survey and general registration. Slopeland which is available for agricultural purposes shall be classified by the limits on its permitted scope of use. Slopeland shall be defined by the central or special municipality regulatory authority as land suitable for agricultural
column2: animal husbandry or forestry purposes or as land subject to strengthened conservation. No land operator or user may exceedingly utilize the land for purposes. The remaining articles make provisions for
column3: inter alia
column4: soil and water conservation obligors
column5: implementation and inspection of oil and water conservation
column6: acquisition of land by aspiring young farmers
column7: treatments for undeveloped slopeland
column8: slopeland development fund
column9: approval of non-agricultural use in reservoir watershed
column10: incentives and penalties.

column1: LEX-FAOC164779;"Decision No. 917 /QD-TTg approving the master plan on socio-economic development of Hoa Binh province through 2020.";"This Decision
column2: consisting of 6 articles and one Appendix
column3: approves the master plan on socio-economic development of Hoa Binh province through 2020 with the following principal contents: The socio-economic development of Hoa Binh province must conform with the overall development of the northern mountainous midland region and the Hanoi Capital region in the context of the country's intensive and extensive international economic integration. To mobilize to the utmost internal resources in combination with talcing advantage of external resources for rapid development; to raise the growth quality and step up economic restructuring toward quickly reducing the propo11ion of agriculture and increasing the propo11ion of industlies and services in both GDP and labor structure. 3. To associate economic development with social development
column4: eliminate hunger and reduce poverty
column5: create jobs
column6: improve the quality of human resources
column7: narrnw the socio­development gap between regions
column8: and improve material and spiritual lives of people. 4. To closely combine economic development with rational exploitation of natural resources and protection of the eco-enviromnent
column9: ensllling sustainable development and creating landscape and enviromnent for tomism development. 5. To associate economic development with development of the urban system and modernization of the infrastructure network. 6. To combine economic development with protection of national defense and security and maintenance of political stability and security as well as social order and safety.The master plan aims at striving for a fast and sustainable economic development to tum Hoa Binh into a province which reaches the average development level of the whole country
column10: a gradually modernized economic and social infrastructure network and a relatively developed urban system. The objectives of the plan include: development of agriculture
column11: forestry and fishery; husbandry in terms of size and quality of cattle herds and poultry; protection
column12: development and rational exploitation of forest resources; sustainable protection and development of the environment and of natural resources; control of environmental pollution; development of water supply
column13: drainage and irrigation systems; and land use and urban planning.

column1: LEX-FAOC162998;"Loi n° 1-17 du 04 septembre 2009 portant révision de la loi n° 1-18 du 04 mai 2006 portant missions
column2: composition
column3: organisation et fonctionnement de la commission nationale des terres et autres biens.";"La présente loi crée la Commission Nationale des Terres et Autres Biens dont la mission de connaître les litiges relatifs aux terres et autres biens opposant les sinistrés à des tiers ou à des services publics ou privés; faire l’inventaire des terres de l’Etat
column4: identifier et proposer la récupération de celles qui ont été irrégulièrement attribuées ou détournées de leur destination; connaître toutes les affaires lui soumises par les sinistrés; fournir une assistance technique pour aider les sinistrés à rentrer dans leurs droits de propriété; proposer au Ministre compétent
column5: l’attribution de nouvelles terres aux sinistrés qui n’en ont pas; connaître des litiges relatifs aux décisions prises par les commissions antérieures et qui n’auraient pas été réglés; étudier les possibilités et les modalités de compensation pour les sinistrés qui n’ont pas recouvré leurs terres ou autres biens ou pour d’autres victimes dont les biens ont été détruites; régler les litiges pendants
column6: relatifs aux terres et autres biens non réglés par les Commissions antérieures. La Commission dispose des pouvoirs les plus étendus liés aux terres et aux autres biens dans le cadre de la réhabilitation des sinistrés. Les décisions de la Commission sont guidées par l’impératif de concilier les objectifs du respect de la loi
column7: de l’équité
column8: de la réconciliation et de la paix sociale.Par ailleurs
column9: elle en définit la composition
column10: l’organisation et le fonctionnement.

column2: composition
column3: organisation et fonctionnement de la commission nationale des terres et autres biens. (2009-11-24)

column1: LEX-FAOC038103;"Council Directive 75/439/EEC on the disposal of waste oils.";"The aim pursued by this Directive is the protection of the environment against the harmful effects caused by the discharge
column2: treatment or deposit of waste oils. For the purposes of these provisions “waste oils” shall mean any liquid or semi-liquid used products totally or partially consisting of mineral or synthetic oil
column3: including the oily residues from tanks
column4: oil-water mixtures and emulsions. Member States must take all necessary measures to ensure the safe collection and disposal of waste oils. In particular
column5: they shall ensure that the disposal of waste oils is carried out by recycling (art. 3). The following are to be prohibited by Member States: (1) any discharge of waste oils into internal surface waters
column7: coastal waters and drainage systems; (2) any deposit or discharge of waste oils harmful to the soil and any uncontrolled discharge of residues resulting from the processing of waste oils; (3) any processing of waste oils causing air pollution which exceeds the level prescribed by existing provisions. Article 6 prescribes that any undertaking which disposes of waste oils must obtain a permit. Such undertakings must be inspected periodically by the competent authorities designated by Member States. Moreover
column8: article 10 provides that any establishment producing
column9: collecting or disposing of more than a given quantity of waste oils per year
column10: to be specified by each Member State but not higher than 500 litres
column11: must keep a record of the quantity
column12: quality
column13: origin and location of such oils and of their despatch and receipt as well as convey such information to the competent authorities on request.

column1: LEX-FAOC038102;"Directive 2000/76/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the incineration of waste.";"A high level of environmental protection and human health protection requires the setting and maintaining of stringent operational conditions
column2: technical requirements and emission limit values for plants incinerating or coincinerating waste within the Community. The aim of this Directive is to prevent or reduce negative effects on the environment
column3: particularly emissions into air
column4: soil
column5: surface water
column6: as well as the resulting risks to human health which might arise from incineration and coincineration of waste. Within this framework
column7: the requirements set forth in Directive 75/442/EEC are to be met.This Directive covers incineration and coincineration plants. However
column8: the plants described by article 2 (2) shall not fall within its scope. No incineration or coincineration plant shall operate without the permit referred to in article 4. Article 5 concerns the precautions to be taken by operators as regards the delivery and reception of waste
column9: particularly hazardous waste. Further operation conditions are laid down in article 6. Waste water from the cleaning of exhaust gases discharged form an incineration or coincineration plant shall be subject to a permit as prescribed by article 8. Residues resulting from the operations hereby envisaged are to be minimized in their amount and harmfulness. Residues shall be recycled directly in the plant or outside in compliance with relevant Community legislation (art. 9). Article 10 deals with control and monitoring. Article 12 regulates access to information and public participation. Six Annexes are attached. Annex II is devoted to the determination of air emission limit values for the coincineration of waste. Annex III describes measurement techniques. Annex IV sets forth emission limit values for discharges of waste water from the cleaning of exhaust gases. Annex V establishes emission limit values. Lastly
column10: Annex VI indicates formula to calculate the emission concentration at the standard percentage oxygen concentration.

column1: LEX-FAOC074523;"Native Administration Ordinance 1922 (No. 17 of 1922).";"This Ordinance grants powers to the Administrator of Nauru to make Regulations affecting the affairs of natives with regard to various matters
column2: including: (a) the succession to property in case of intestacy; (b) the rights to real and personal property; and (c) the cultivation of the soil. ""Native"" in this Ordinance shall mean an aboriginal of the Island of Nauru
column3: and shall include an aboriginal native of China
column4: or of any Island of the Pacific Ocean
column5: or of any of the East India Islands
column7: and shall include also any person who is wholly or partly descended from any aboriginal native or natives aforesaid.

column1: LEX-FAOC109217;"Ley Nº 183 - Ley de Servidumbre de Conservación de Puerto Rico.";"La presente Ley establece el marco normativo para la constitución de servidumbres de conservación sobre predios rústicos o urbanos dentro de Puerto Rico
column2: para propósitos de protección o conservación de un área de valor natural o de una propiedad con valor cultural o agrícola. La Ley especifica que la servidumbre podrá constituirse para las siguientes finalidades: a) conservar el atributo natural
column3: agrícola
column4: de bosque o escénico de una propiedad o su condición como espacio abierto; b) proteger cuencas hidrográficas; c) mantener o mejorar la calidad del aire o las aguas; d) conservar propiedades con valor cultural; e) conservar propiedades con valor agrícola. Pueden ser titulares de servidumbres de conservación el Estado Libre Asociado de Puerto Rico o las organizaciones sin fines de lucro entre cuyas funciones o propósitos principales esté la protección o conservación de un área de valor natural o de una propiedad de valor cultural.
