column1: LEX-FAOC152231;"Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper- A National Programme for Food Security
column2: Job Creation and Good Governance.";"The Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper - A National Programme for Food Security
column3: Job Creation and Good Governance (PRSP) is a cross-sectoral national strategy paper of Sierra Leone. It is in force for the period of 2005-2007. Its main objective is to address the poverty challenges and attain food security and create employment opportunities.Achieving food security is at the heart of Sierra Leone’s poverty reduction strategy in the next three years. The government’s overall objective in the period is to reduce hunger and malnutrition and accelerate the attainment of the Millennium Development Goals. Attaining food security will contribute significantly to the attainment of other important poverty reduction goals
column4: especially the reduction of child malnutrition and mortality and improvement in maternal health on a sustainable basis. According to the PRSP
column5: addressing food security requires coordinated short and medium term strategies and measures in the key sectors that influence the various dimensions of the country’s food problems. Interventions will include addressing availability and sustainability of food supply and accessibility at the household and national levels in the short to medium term. Some of these strategies have been adequately elaborated in the Government’s Food Security Strategy elaborated by the Ministry of Agriculture and Food Security. The short and medium term strategies will be combined with other sectoral interventions
column6: including incentives and facilities to attract private sector investment in agricultural production
column7: to ensure sustainability in increased food production
column8: create rural jobs and income for growth in agriculture
column9: livestock and fisheries sectors.A Right to Food Secretariat (RFS) has already been set up by the Government and its partners to support the coordination of activities in the food security sector. The work of this Secretariat will be strengthened to maximise the synergy among the productive
column10: infrastructure and social sector activities that will accelerate the achievement of food security within the medium term.In the fisheries sub-sector
column11: government’s short and medium objective is to increase supply of fish to the domestic market and for export. The strategy is to support fishermen and women engaged in both the artisanal and aquaculture sub-sectors with essential inputs and skills training in processing. In the marine sub-sector
column12: the thrust is to maximise fish landing for export and the domestic market. A major investment proposal is the construction of a modern fishing harbour in Freetown to support this strategy.In the agricultural sector
column13: the short term objectives of government intervention are diversification of the crop mix in the uplands
column14: and intensification of production from the small hectares cultivated in the lowlands. This will be achieved through the introduction of new technology
column15: input provision through credible farmers’ associations at the local level
column16: and targeted extension support
column17: especially to the unemployed youth and the small-scale farmers. More vulnerable farmers will also be targeted with food-for-work. This will contribute to an increase in food production to tackle hunger at household level in the rural areas in the short term. The Government will also continue to encourage private sector investment in agriculture
column18: especially for the production of food for the market
column19: in the short term. Provision of inputs and appropriate farm machinery on a cost recovery basis or favourable credit terms as appropriate and extension support will be central to this strategy. Also
column20: government will work through local authorities to facilitate access by private sector operators to land for commercial cultivation and markets and storage facilities.In the medium term
column21: support to small-scale farmers will aim at increasing their capacity to produce enough to meet their own input needs directly or through established input and output markets. Emphasis will also be placed on increasing the stability and reliability of food supplies through a comprehensive feeder (farm-to-market) roads programme and the provision of market
column22: storage and drying floor infrastructure in all chiefdoms in the country. Operations research and development
column23: land development and use
column24: and extensive training of extension staff and farmers will also be pursued.A large number of institutions will be involved in the implementation of the programmes in the PRSP at all levels – national
column25: district
column26: chiefdom and ward – to reflect the diversity of interests expressed in the participatory phase of the process. The coordination and implementation arrangements will be structured in a flexible manner to accommodate the diverse entities in Government
column27: civil society
column28: local communities and the private sector. The institutional framework supporting the M&E system will involve many agencies both within the public sector (line ministries
column31: etc.) and without (NGOs
column33: CSOs) to reflect the broad interest generated in the PRSP
column34: the participatory approach used in its preparation and the transparency in governance espoused by government. The M&E framework will involve greater coordination of efforts of all the institutions.

column1: LEX-FAOC005062;"Forest
column2: Soil and Water Conservation Ordinance.";"The Governor shall appoint a Chief Forest Officer (sect. 3). The Governor may appoint forest officers (sec.4). The Agricultural Superintendent and other specified officials shall be ex-officio Forest Officers (sect. 5). The Governor in Council may declare any area of Crown land to be a forest reserve (sect. 6) or to be a prohibited area (sec.13) or declare any area on private land to be a protected forest (sect. 7). Section 8 specifies prohibited activities. Owners of land which is declared a protected forest may be compensated (sect. 11). Sections 14 to 18 provide for legal action to be taken against persons in wrongful possession of Crown Lands. Straying live-stock may be seized and be forfeited to the Crown (sect. 19). Other provisions of this Ordinance deal with enforcement measures
column3: offences and regulation making powers of the Governor in Council. (33 sections and a Schedule)

column1: LEX-FAOC085856;"Ordonnance relative à la gestion et à l'assainissement des sols pollués (1).";"La présente ordonnance vise à prévenir l'apparition de la pollution du sol
column2: à identifier les sources potentielles de pollution
column3: à organiser les études du sol permettant d'établir l'existence d'une pollution et à déterminer les modalités de l'assainissement des sols pollués ou de leur gestion et ce
column4: en vue de garantir la suppression
column5: le contrôle
column6: l'endiguement ou la réduction de la pollution du sol. Elle vise également à organiser l'accès aux informations relatives à la pollution des sols. Le texte comprend 86 articles répartis en 13 sections comme suit: Dispositions générales (Ier); Identification des terrains pollués (II); Traitement des terrains pollués (III); Gestion du risque (IV); Assainissement (V); Autres mesures (VI); Consultation et information (VII); Recours (VIII); Dispositions particulières (IX); Financement (X); Sanctions (XI); Dispositions modificatives (XII); Dispositions transitoires
column7: abrogatoire et finale (XIII).En outre le présent ordonnance modifie l'ordonnance du 5 juin 1997 relative aux permis d'environnement; l'ordonnance du 25 mars 1999 relative à la recherche
column8: la constatation
column9: la poursuite et la répression des infractions en matière d'environnement; l'arrêté royal du 8 mars 1989 créant l'Institut bruxellois pour la gestion de l'environnement.

column1: LEX-FAOC149899;"Regional Law No. 130/2015-OZ “On public control”.";"This Regional Law establishes the modalities of organization and performance of public control as a form of public participation. It shall not be applicable to elections and referendum. Regional executive bodies shall have the following plenary powers: (a) formation of advisory councils at the regional executive bodies; (b) examination of final documents drafted by public control bodies; and (c) consideration of proposals
column2: recommendations and conclusions contained in the final documents. Public control shall be performed by the Public (Civic) Chambers
column3: advisory councils at the regional executive bodies and local government
column4: public inspections and public control groups. Public control can initiate public hearings
column5: obtain results of inspections performed by regional and municipal executive bodies and participate at joint supervisory (control) arrangements.

column1: LEX-FAOC157199;"Registration of Title Act
column2: No. 21 of 1998.";"This Registration of Title Act
column3: consisting of 45 sections
column4: specifies the registration of title to every land parcel in accordance with the cadastral map prepared for that purpose. On the publication of an Order under section I of this Act
column5: the Commissioner of Title Settlement shall request the Surveyor-General to prepare cadastral maps for the areas specified in such Order and upon such request the Surveyor-General shall cause such cadastral maps to be prepared and certified copies of the same to be issued to the Commissioner of Title Settlement. The Commissioner of Title Settlement shall
column6: on receipt of such certified copies of cadastral maps publish a Notice in the Gazette
column7: calling for any claimants to the land parcel specified in such Notice to submit their claims to him within a prescribed period from the date of publication of such Notice. The Commissioner of Title Settlement shall cause an investigation to be conducted in order to determine the genuinness or otherwise of claims made in response to a Notice under section 12. The beneficiaries may apply to the Commissioner of Title Settlement to appoint another co-owner as the Manager or the co-owned land parcel
column8: on specific land registration.

column1: LEX-FAOC088994;"Land Use Planning Act.";"The main aim of the present Act is to ensure that the entire territory of the Federal Republic of Germany and the related regions shall be developed
column2: organized and protected by general regional plans. In so doing 1) differing requirements shall be harmonized and related conflicts shall be solved at local planning level; 2) provisions shall be made regarding specific activities and individual land uses. The text consists of 29 articles divided into 4 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Land use planning in the “Länder” (II); Federal land use planning (3); Completing provisions and final provisions (4). Two Annexes are enclosed.

column1: LEX-FAOC063639;"Decree No. 4/01 regulating Coastal Management Plans (POOC).";"This Decree
column2: composed of 18 articles and two Annexes
column3: regulates spatial planning of all national coastal area. In particular
column4: it regulates the formulation and approval of Coastal Area Management Plans (POOC). The Decree defines POOC objectives
column5: formulation requirements and procedures. Moreover
column6: it institutes Permanent Technical Commissions to operate at Province level providing technical recommendations. Furthermore
column7: the Decree rules on POOC approval and on the subsequent public works’ implementation (including control procedures). Finally
column8: it recalls applicable sanctions. Annex I provides a list of relevant definitions; Annex II defines general principles to be observed during coastal land occupation
column9: use and transformation.

column5: falta de transparencia y posible engaño a compradores y vendedores o al Estado.

column1: LEX-FAOC149892;"Regional Law No. 52-ZS “On public control”.";"This Regional Law establishes the modalities of organization and performance of public control as a form of public participation. It shall not be applicable to elections and referendum. Regional executive bodies shall have the following plenary powers: (a) formation of advisory councils at the regional executive bodies; (b) examination of final documents drafted by public control bodies; and (c) consideration of proposals
column2: recommendations and conclusions contained in the final documents. Public control shall be performed by the Public (Civic) Chambers
column3: advisory councils at the regional executive bodies and local government
column4: public inspections and public control groups. Public control can initiate public hearings
column5: obtain results of inspections performed by regional and municipal executive bodies and participate at joint supervisory (control) arrangements.

column1: LEX-FAOC131602;"Saxon Agricultural Task Transfer Law.";"The present Law implements the Land Parcel Act of 28 July 1961
column2: the Land Lease Contracts Act of 8 November 1985
column3: the Agricultural Adaption Act in its version of of 3 July 1991. In particular
column4: the Law lays down provisions relating to the correct and efficient implementation of the afore-mentioned Acts. The text consists of 4 articles as follows: Agricultural authorities (1); Competences (2); Enforcement of the Land Parcel Act (3); Vocational training in agriculture and forestry (4).

column1: LEX-FAOC085489;"Environmental Management Act ([SBC 2003] Chapter 53).";"A piece of basic legislation in the field of environmental management. The text consists of 179 sections divided into 12 Parts as follows: Introductory provisions (1); Prohibitions and authorizations (2); Municipal waste management (3); Contaminated site remediation (4); Remediation of mineral exploration sites and mines (5); Clean air provisions (6); Powers in relation to managing the environment (7); Appeals (8); Compliance (9); General (10); Transitional provisions and consequential amendments (11).

column1: LEX-FAOC164237;"Haida Gwaii Reconciliation Act ([SBC 2010] Chapter 17).";"The present Act implements commitments set out in the Kunst’aa Guu – Kunst’aayah Reconciliation Protocol between the Province and the Haida Nation
column2: which was signed 11 December 2009. The decision-making framework provides for the establishment of a Management Council made up of two appointees by each of the Haida Nation and the Province under their respective authorities
column3: as well as a jointly appointed Chair. This Management Council will be responsible for making land and natural resource decisions over most of Haida Gwaii
column4: including: 1) Implementation and amendment of the Haida Gwaii Strategic Land Use Agreement; 2) Establishing land use objectives for forest and range practices; 3) Determining the overall allowable annual cut; 4) Approving protected areas management plans; 5) Developing policies and standards for the identification and conservation of heritage sites.

column1: LEX-FAOC157209;"Regional Decree No. 101-PP/Z “On the modalities of performance of municipal land control”.";"This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of performance of municipal land control by local government. Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs. The subject of inspection shall be checking data and information contained in the documentation related to land tenure. The scope of inspection shall be to control compliance by land tenant with compulsory legislative requirements related to land tenure with a view of prevention and suppression of unauthorized transactions with land. Municipal land control shall be performed in accordance with the annual plans. The outcome of municipal land control shall be legalized in the form of inspection certificate.

column1: LEX-FAOC045669;"Arrêté ministériel portant certaines dispositions d'exécution relatives à la ""démarche qualité"" et au ""survey surfaces agricoles"" de l'arrêté du Gouvernement wallon du 10 octobre 2002 relatif à la gestion durable de l'azote en agriculture.";"Le présent arrêté ministériel porte certaines dispositions d'exécution relatives à la ""démarche qualité"" et au ""survey surfaces agricoles"" de l'arrêté du Gouvernement wallon du 10 octobre 2002 relatif à la gestion durable de l'azote en agriculture. Avec le terme «démarche qualité» on entend l’engagement d'un agriculteur ou d'un groupe d'agriculteurs à gérer le risque environnemental de l'activité agricole en ce qui concerne la pollution des eaux par le nitrate conformément aux articles 30 à 35 de l'arrêté du Gouvernement wallon du 10 octobre 2002 relatif à la gestion durable de l'azote en agriculture. L’article 2 établit qu’en automne de chaque année
column2: des échantillons de sol sont prélevés dans un ensemble de parcelles de l'exploitation de l'agriculteur engagé en démarche qualité en vue d'établir des profils azotés et afin d'établir le caractère satisfaisant et durable des APL. Le texte comprend 19 articles répartis en 6 chapitres comme suit: Définitions (Ier); Survey surfaces agricoles(II); Bilans systémiques d'azote dans les exploitations inscrites en démarche qualité (III); Mesures
column3: pratiques et modes de gestion agronomiques favorables à une amélioration de la gestion de l'azote dont l'objectif est d'améliorer prioritairement les résultats d'APL ainsi que les résultats de bilans d'azote dans le cadre de la démarche qualité (IV); Surveillance et évaluation (V); Autres dispositions générales (VI). Neuf annexes sont jointes.

column1: LEX-FAOC159665;"Law on Land Reform.";"The purpose of this Act is to regulate general principles governing the limits of ownership of lands by individuals in the country. In particular
column2: no one may own more than a certain amount of land in the whole country. Any land in excess shall be seized by the Government and redistributed. Fruit and tea gardens
column3: as well as agricultural land are exempt from this limitation. Abandoned land
column4: wasteland and land exceeding the maximum permitted
column5: are considered eligible for division and redistribution. According to the Act
column6: farmers are considered as priority in land redistribution. The transferees shall receive an ownership document in return of monthly installment of the land’s price. The present Law shall be enforced by the Government at a national level and by the Land Reform Commissions in each Province. The Act consists of 38 articles
column7: subdivided in 8 Chapters and relative Sections as follows: General Definitions (I); Limits to Ownership (II); Division of Land and Relevant Provisions (III); Evaluation and Payment of Fees (IV); Provisions regarding Division and Transfer of Land (V); Provisions on Land Division (VI); Financial Regulations (VII); Provisions Regarding Technical Assistance and Support of Farmers (VIII).

column1: LEX-FAOC153187;"Décret n°2015-0889-P-RM du 31 décembre 2015 déterminant le plan d’organisation des secours au Mali plan ORSEC.";"Le présent décret détermine le Plan d’Organisation des Secours (Plan ORSEC). Le Plan ORSEC est un document réglementaire permettant la coordination des secours sous une autorité unique.Le plan ORSEC est activé dans les situations de crises majeures ou de catastrophes mettant en péril des vies humaines et occasionnant des pertes matérielles considérables sur les infrastructures socioéconomiques vitales d’une manière générale: calamités naturelles telles que: inondation
column2: sécheresse
column3: invasions acridiennes
column4: invasions aviaires
column5: épidémies
column7: feux de brousses
column8: épizooties); incendies; accidents technologiques explosions; risques biologiques et nucléaires; accidents dans les mines; conflits communautaires; ruptures de barrages; accident de transport: routier
column9: aérien
column10: ferroviaire
column11: fluvial; mouvements de foules
column12: paniques
column13: émeutes
column14: conflits sociaux et guerre; attentats terroristes; attentat sur les monuments et édifices intégrés dans le patrimoine national et international; tout événement faisant apparaître une notion de risque collectif et/ou évolutif pour les personnes
column15: les biens et l’environnement.Le plan ORSECs’articule autour du dispositif institutionnel suivant: un Poste de Commandement Fixe; un Poste de Commandement des Opérations ou Poste Avancé; une Cellule Information et Relation Publique; des Groupes Opérationnels.Ce decret prévoit au niveau de la Commune: le Plan ORSEC communal; au niveau du Cercle: le Plan ORSEC local; au niveau de la Région et du district: le Plan ORSEC régional; et au niveau national: le Plan ORSEC national.A ce Plan ORSEC sont annexés des plans spécifiques adaptés à chaque type de crises ou catastrophes: plan inondation; plan de transport de matières dangereuses; plan de perturbation importante sur un réseau d’eau potable; plan sauvetage aéroterrestre; plan d’accident de chemin de fer; plans particuliers d’intervention; plan de secours fluvial ; plan électro-secours; plan NRBC (jaune); plans particuliers d’intervention (PPI); plan de Mise en Sureté des Etablissements Scolaires; plan invasion acridienne; plan incendie; plan invasion aviaire; plan feu de brousse.

column1: LEX-FAOC163586;"Payment of Compensation for Property Situated on Landholdings Expropriated for Public Purposes Council of Ministers Regulations (No 135/2007).";"These Regulations issued under article 14(1) of the Expropriation of Landholdings for Public Purposes and Payment of Compensation Proclamation No. 455/2005 concerns not only payment of compensation to but also aims at assisting in other ways persons displaced by expropriation under the Proclamation to restore their livelihood. Compensation shall also be paid for crops and trees. The amount of compensation for crops shall be calculated by multiplying the amount of yield that would have been collected from the land at maturity by the current market price of the crops. The Regulations provides formulas for the calculation of compensation.Where land used for growing crops or a protected grass or pastoral land is expropriated for public purpose
column2: the possessor of such land shall
column3: as much as possible
column4: be provided with a plot of land capable of serving a similar purpose. Provisions is also made for displacement compensation for protected grass or grazing land and for temporary expropriation of rural land.

column1: LEX-FAOC010530;"Arrêté du Gouvernement flamand fixant le règlement flamand relatif à l'assainissement du sol.";"Cet arrêté du Gouvernement flamand fixant le règlement flamand relatif à l'assainissement du sol est formé par 45 articles répartis en 8 chapitres: Définitions (I); Etablissements et activités pouvant engendrer une pollution du sol (II); Agrément d'experts en assainissement du sol (III); Registre des terrains pollués et attestations du sol (IV); Normes d'assainissement du sol et valeurs de fond (V); Procédures d'appel visées dans le décret (VI); Sûretés financières (VII); Dispositions finales (VIII). Sont jointes 6 annexes à cet arrêté.

column1: LEX-FAOC157332;"Regional Decree No. 223 “On the modalities of performance of municipal land control”.";"This Regional Decree establishes the modalities of performance of municipal land control by local government. Municipal land control shall be conducted in the form of ordinary and extraordinary inspections of legal persons and individual entrepreneurs. The subject of inspection shall be checking data and information contained in the documentation related to land tenure. The scope of inspection shall be to control compliance by land tenant with compulsory legislative requirements related to land tenure with a view of prevention and suppression of unauthorized transactions with land. Municipal land control shall be performed in accordance with the annual plans. The outcome of municipal land control shall be legalized in the form of inspection certificate. Annexes contain inspection order and compliance certificate.

column1: LEX-FAOC014835;"Land Grants (Special Provisions) Act 1979.";"The Minister may
column2: by Order published in the Gazette
column3: vest in the State land that is vested in the Land Reform Commission under the Land Reform Law. The Order shall: (a) specify the extent of agricultural or estate land; (b) make reference to the survey plan made by the Surveyor-General in respect of such land; (c) specify any servitude attaching to such agricultural or estate land. According to Section 2(3) every Order shall be final and conclusive and shall not be called in question in any court.Moreover
column4: the Act regulates the procedure to be followed for the transfer
column5: free of charge
column6: by the President of any portion of land vested in the State to any citizen of Sri Lanka over eighteen years of age. The transfer shall be made on the basis of the criteria set out in Section 3 and upon the conditions listed in section 5.Further provisions concern the nomination of successors to State land transferred according to the above and the devolution of rights in State land in the absence of nomination of successors.

column1: LEX-FAOC157427;"Regional Law No. 17-RZ “On soil fertility of agricultural land”.";"This Regional Law establishes legal grounds of the relations between landowners
column2: landlords
column3: land tenants and state bodies in the sphere of ensuring soil fertility of agricultural land
column4: and also establishes rights and duties of natural and legal persons performing agricultural production in relation to efficient use of soil fertility. Particularly precious fertile agricultural land categories shall be classified as follows: (a) agricultural land with cadastre valuation exceeding by 50 percent and over average cadastre valuation in a given municipal district; (b) experimental agricultural areas of scientific research institutions; (c) land under perennial crops and grasses; and (d) land with waterworks and protection forests ensuring soil fertility reproduction. Soil fertility of all types of agricultural land must ensure sufficient conditions for crop growing without oppression of soil organisms. Use of particularly fertile agricultural land for non-agricultural purposes shall be prohibited except for cases envisaged by acting legislation.

column1: LEX-FAOC050594;"Law No. 99-Z on amendments and addenda to Land Code.";"Part three of the article 141 acquires a new wording: “Land monitoring shall be carried out at the expense of state budget. The contents and the modalities of carrying out land monitoring shall be established by the Council of Ministers.” Article 143 acquires a new wording: “State land cadastre shall consist of common register of administrative and territorial
column2: and territorial units
column3: register of the plots of land
column4: register of valuation of the plots of land
column5: register of cost of the plots of land and register of land resources.” Article 145 acquires a new wording: “Objects of land survey shall be land of administrative and territorial units
column7: protected areas
column8: areas under special state regulation determined by the national legislation
column9: plots of land and parts thereof conceded into private ownership or lease.” Article 147 acquires a new wording: “Compulsory land surveying arrangements shall be carried out in the following cases: 1) change of boundaries of the objects of land survey or lack of data thereabout; 2) expropriation and concession of the plots of land; 3) change of destination of a plot of land; 4) transfer of land from one category into another; 5) establishment of servitude and other use restrictions; 6) exposure of disturbed land.”

column1: LEX-FAOC141716;"Law ""On circulation of fertilizers"".";"The scope of this Law shall be to protect users of fertilizers against application of poor quality fertilizers that are dangerous for human and animal health. Persons performing manufacturing
column2: application
column3: packaging and import of fertilizers shall submit to State Plant Protection Service the following documentation: (a) application for state registration of fertilizers; and (b) annually by 31 December submit data related to manufactured
column4: applied or imported fertilizers with classification of fertilizers related to the previous year. Poor quality fertilizers that is dangerous for human and animal health and that cannot be rendered harmless shall be disposed of by the manufacturer or handler.

column1: LEX-FAOC014839;"State Lands Ordinance 1949.";"The Ordinance consists of the following Parts: Grants
column2: Leases
column3: and Other Dispositions of State Land (I); Execution
column4: Authentication and Registration of Instruments of Dispositions (II); Vesting Orders and Vested Land (III); State Lands Vested in Village Councils (IV); Special Leases by Local Authorities of Lands Vested in Such Authorities (V); Reservations (VI); Road Reservations (VII); The Foreshore (VIII); Regulation and Control of the Use of the Water of Lakes and Public Streams (IX); Recovery of Payments Due to the State and Cancellation of Instruments of Disposition (X); Administration (XI); Regulations (XII); Miscellaneous (XIII); Interpretation and Savings (XIV).The President may make grants
column5: leases and other dispositions of State land and accept the surrender of any land according to the provisions of Parts I-VII. An instrument of disposition shall effect every disposition of State land. The instrument shall be signed and executed by the President in cases of State land granted or sold
column6: or leased for a term exceeding the prescribed period; every other instrument of disposition shall be signed and executed by the prescribed officer. Further provisions concern vested land for purposes of administration in any naval
column7: military
column8: air force or local authority
column9: State lands vested in Village Councils
column10: special leases by local authorities of lands vested in such authorities
column11: constitution of State reservations
column12: recovery of payments due to the State
column13: cancellation of instruments of disposition
column14: administration of the Ordinance by the Land Commissioner. According to the provisions of Part VIII the administration
column15: control
column16: custody and management of the foreshore are vested in the State. The President is authorized: (a) to construct quays
column17: wharves or other works; (b) to dredge the bed of the sea; (c) to reclaim any part of the foreshore or bed of the sea; (d) to erect buildings on any areas reclaimed from the sea; (e) to lease or otherwise dispose of any reclaimed area. Without prejudice to the rights of the public the President may lease any part of the foreshore or bed of the sea
column18: and the Government Agent may issue permits for the occupation of any part of the foreshore or bed of the sea for a period not exceeding one year. Section 63 establishes the power of the Minister to declare areas from which no sand
column19: stone
column20: coral or other substance shall be removed. The Government Agent may prohibit the removal of sand
column21: etc. from any particular place on the foreshore according to the provisions of Section 64. ""Foreshore"" means the shore of the Island of Sri Lanka between high-water mark and lower-water mark as per Section 110 of the Ordinance. The right to the use and flow and to the management and control of the water in any public lake or public stream shall vest in the State. However
column22: the right shall not be exercised in contravention of any right lawfully exercisable by any person
column23: company
column24: corporation
column25: board or local authority and shall be subject to the rights of the occupiers of land on the banks of public lakes or streams as well as of holders of permits issued under Part IX of the Ordinance. The occupiers of land on the bank of any public lake or stream shall have the right to use the water for domestic purposes
column26: for the purpose of watering cattle or other stock and for agricultural purposes
column27: subject to the condition that the water shall not by diverted through a channel
column28: drain or pipe or by means of mechanical contrivance
column29: but shall be removed in a bucket or other receptacle. Furthermore
column31: construct or maintain any work in
column33: any public lake or stream except under authority of a permit issued by the Government Agent or other prescribed officer. Further provisions concern the procedure to be followed by the applicant
column34: the matter to be taken into account in considering the application
column35: the appointment of an advisory board to assist the Government Agent in the consideration of applications
column36: the cases in which the permits shall be cancelled
column37: and the penalties to be applied in case of violation.

column1: LEX-FAOC038317;"Resolution of the Council and the Representatives of the Governments of the Member States
column2: meeting within the Council of 1 February 1993 on a Community programme of policy and action in relation to the environment and sustainable development - A European Community programme of policy and action in relation to the environment and sustainable development (Fifth Environment Action Programme).";"The Council and the representatives of the Member States adopted this Resolution in order to approve the general approach and strategy of the programme 'Towards sustainability' presented by the Commission. As a result
column3: a European Community programme of policy and action in relation to the environment and sustainable development is hereby laid down. The programme deals with a number of issues in connection with the sustainable development topic. Part I of the programme outlines the policy and strategy to be applied at Community level by involving at the same time public authorities
column4: public and private enterprises as well as the general public. The programme is to be implemented in different selected target sectors (industry
column5: energy
column7: agriculture and tourism) and by facing the following themes: climate change
column8: acidification and air quality
column9: protection of nature and biodiversity
column10: management of water resources
column11: urban environment
column12: coastal zones as well as waste management. The objectives to be attained include improvement of environmental data and development of scientific research and technology. Part II describes the Community’s role in the wider international arena
column13: taking into particular account problems of regional of local concern. Part III sets priorities and deals with costs to be faced.

column1: LEX-FAOC139087;"Regulations of Hainan Special Economic Zone on forest land administration.";"The purpose of these Regulations is to strengthen the protection and management of forest land
column2: rationally develop and utilize forest resources
column3: promote sustainable economic and social development. The Text consists of 44 articles divided into 6 Chapters: General Provisions (I); Forest Land Tenure Management (II); Forest Land Protection and Utilization (III); Forest Land Expropriation and Occupation (IV); Legal Liability (V); Supplementary Provisions (VI).Forest land belongs to the State and collectives. All forest lands with state ownership and collective ownership may be determined according to law to be used by entities or individuals for forestry production. The lawful rights and interests of the owners and users of forest land are protected by law.

column1: LEX-FAOC154514;"Tlicho Community Government Act (S.N.W.T 2004
column2: c. 7).";"The present Act establishes the community government of Behchoko
column3: Whatì
column4: Gamètì
column5: and Wekweetì
column6: and describes their boundaries. This Act covers the composition and role of the community council
column7: eligibility to vote
column8: the duties of the chief
column9: and it details the powers of these municipalities. The Tlicho Community Government of Behchoko is a municipal corporation with responsibilities for community planning
column10: public works and community improvements
column11: public utilities such as water quality
column12: water delivery and sewage services as well as emergency response planning and fire protection
column13: recreation and other services such as bylaw enforcement. The Community Government administers all lands within Behchoko
column14: and regulates land use and development through its Community Plan
column15: Zoning By-law
column16: leasing
column17: and development permit processes. The text consists of 176 sections divided into7 Parts as follows: Establishment (1); Administration (2); General powers (3); Legislative powers (4); Financial affairs (5); Liability and enforcement (6); Other matters (7). Two Schedules are enclosed.

column1: LEX-FAOC158081;"Sahtu Dene and Metis Comprehensive Land Claim Agreement.";"The Sahtu Dene and Metis and Canada have negotiated this Agreement in order to meet the following objectives: a) to provide for certainty and clarity of rights to ownership and use of land and resources; b) to provide the specific rights and benefits in this agreement in exchange for the relinquishment by the Sahtu Dene and Metis of certain rights claimed in any part of Canada by treaty or otherwise; c) to recognize and encourage the way of life of the Sahtu Dene and Metis which is based on the cultural and economic relationship between them and the land; d) to encourage the self-sufficiency of the Sahtu Dene and Metis and to enhance their ability to participate fully in all aspects of the economy; e) to provide the Sahtu Dene and Metis with specific benefits
column2: including financial compensation
column3: land and other economic benefits; f) to provide the Sahtu Dene and Metis with wildlife harvesting rights and the right to participate in decision making concerning wildlife harvesting and management; g) to provide the Sahtu Dene and Metis the right to participate in decision making concerning the use
column4: management and conservation of land
column5: water and resources; h) to protect and conserve the wildlife and environment of the settlement area for present and future generations; and i) to ensure the Sahtu Dene and Metis the opportunity to negotiate self-government agreements.The text consists of 29 Sections as follows: Objectives (1); Definitions (2); General provisions (3); Eligibility and enrolment (4); Self-government (5); Dispute resolution (6); Sahtu Organizations (7); Financial payments (8); Normal wells proven area (9); Resource royalties (10; Tazation (11); Economic measures (12); Wildlife harvesting and management (13); Forestry (14); Plants (15); National parks (16); Protected areas (17); harvesting compensation (18); Sahtu lands (19); Water rights and management (20); Access (21); Subsurface resources (22); Sahtu municipal lands (23); Expropriation of settlement lands (24); Land and water regulation (25); heritage resources (26); Surface Rights Board (27); Other aboriginal claims (28); Implementation (29).

column1: LEX-FAOC077814;"Consumers
column2: Estate Agents and Redress Act 2007  (Chapter 17).";"This Act creates a National Consumer Council to replace the existing consumer protection bodies and in general makes provision for the protection of customers in relation to utility supply and other specified contracts. The Act also contains a power to dissolve the Consumer Council for Water and transfer its functions to the Council established by the Act.The Act empowers the Secretary of State to require service providers in the electricity and gas (in Great Britain) and water (in England and Wales) sectors to adhere to redress schemes to ensure resolution of complaints in those sectors and to award compensation where warranted and to contribute towards the costs consumer protection.The Act does not extend these powers to the water sector because the Secretary of State already has a power to prescribe complaint-handling standards in relation to water undertakers and sewerage undertakers in England and Wales under the Water Industry Act 1991.Part of the Act concerns the work of estate agents and the protection of their customers.

column1: LEX-FAOC161621;"Mémorandum d'entente entre le Gouvernement de la République algérienne démocratique et populaire et le Gouvernement de la République portugaise dans le domaine de l'aménagement du territoire et de l'environnement
column2: signé e Alger
column3: le 10 mars 2015.";"Ce Mémorandum d’entente vise à promouvoir la coopération en matière d’aménagement du territoire (ingénierie du territoire; l’attractivité du territoire; les mécanismes d’évaluation des instruments d’aménagement du territoire) et de l’environnement (la gestion des déchets urbains et industriels; la promotion des technologies de productions propres; la promotion des emplois verts; la conservation de la biodiversité et des sols; la restauration des habitats naturels dégradés et l’ingénierie verte; l’adaptation aux changements climatiques; la valorisation et l’aménagement intégré des zones de Montagnes)
column4: en créant les conditions nécessaires au développement de la coopération et du partenariat en matière environnementale
column5: au moyen du renforcement des capacités et de compétences que les deux signataires jugent utiles. Par ailleurs
column6: il définit les modalités de coopération et prévoit un mécanisme de suivi et d’évaluation.

column1: LEX-FAOC122794;"Guideline No.2 dated 13.1.2010 on the methods of verification and examination of the legal validity of  agricultural land ownership titles by the local commissions established for such purpose.";"The Guideline No. 2 of 2010 lays down methods for the verification and examination of the legal validity of the agricultural land ownership titles by the local commissions established for such purpose. The verifications are done for requests submitted by the local offices of immovable property registration offices and the land protection and administration units at the regional council. The Ministry of Agriculture
column2: Food and Consumer Protection and the Land Governmental Commission are responsible authorities for the process implementation. Model decisions are also attached to the guidelines.

column1: LEX-FAOC150980;"Administration (Real Estate) Law (Cap. 3).";"This Act provides for the administration of estates of persons that die intestate. When a person dies intestate leaving any real property of whatsoever nature of which the intestate might have disposed of by will
column2: such real property shall for the purposes of ad ministration be deemed to be part of the personal estate of the said intestate and shall be administered accordingly. The Act also stipulates that real property
column3: the succession to which cannot be affected by customary law
column4: shall by testamentary disposition descend in accordance with the provisions of such customary law despite anything contrary contained herein.

column1: LEX-FAOC013624;"Sale of State Lands (Special Provisions) Law 1973 (No. 43 of 1973).";"This Law regulates the sale of State land available for the purpose of agricultural development. It consists of the following Chapters: Sale of State land (I); Grants and Permits (II); Protection of Land held on Permits or Grants (III); Dispositions (IV); Succession (V); Cancellation of Permits (VI); Regulations (VII); General (VIII).The Government Agent of each administrative district shall from time to time make a report to the Land Commissioner of any State land available for alienation by way of sale for the purpose of agricultural development. The Land Commissioner shall take action on any report and then convey his decision to the Government Agent
column2: who shall decide on any application made after the date prescribed in the notification of sale of State land. The persons to whom land shall be alienated shall be selected from such class of persons as may be prescribed (sect. 6
column3: para. 3)
column4: at a price to be determined by the Land Commissioner.Further provisions concern inter alia the issue of grants or permits in favor of the selected persons
column5: the payment of the price of land and any other fee required
column6: the disposition of land by will
column7: the cancellation of permits
column8: legal proceedings.

column1: LEX-FAOC013621;"Requisitioning of Land Act 1950 (No. 33 of 1950).";"This Act regulates the power of the competent authorities to take possession
column2: with the prior approval of the President
column3: of any land for any of the following purposes: (a) maintenance of supplies or services essential to the life of the community; (b) implementation of schemes regarding the import
column4: storage or distribution of commodities by any Government department
column5: local authority
column6: corporation of cooperative society; (c) use or occupation by the armed forces or any visiting force (sect. 2). A compensation in respect of requisitioned land shall be paid in accordance with the provisions of sections 5 and 6. Disputes arising as to the right to compensation shall be settled according to sections 10 to 14 of the Land Acquisition Act.

column1: LEX-FAOC154427;"Real Decreto Legislativo Nº 7/2015 - Ley de Suelo y Rehabilitación Urbana. Texto refundido.";"El presente Real Decreto aprueba el texto refundido de la Ley de Suelo y Rehabilitación Urbana y de la Ley de rehabilitación
column2: regeneración y renovación urbanas. Esta Ley regula las condiciones básicas que garantizan: 1) la igualdad en el ejercicio de los derechos y en el cumplimiento de los deberes constitucionales
column3: relacionados con el suelo; 2) un desarrollo sostenible
column4: competitivo y eficiente del medio urbano
column5: mediante el impulso y el fomento de las actuaciones que conducen a la rehabilitación de los edificios y a la regeneración y renovación de los tejidos urbanos existentes
column6: cuando sean necesarias para asegurar a los ciudadanos una adecuada calidad de vida y la efectividad de su derecho a disfrutar de una vivienda digna y adecuada. Asimismo
column7: establece las bases económicas y medioambientales del régimen jurídico del suelo
column8: su valoración y la responsabilidad patrimonial de las Administraciones Públicas en la materia.Las políticas públicas relativas a la regulación
column9: ordenación
column10: ocupación
column11: transformación y uso del suelo tienen como fin común la utilización de este recurso conforme al interés general y según el principio de desarrollo sostenible
column12: sin perjuicio de los fines específicos que les atribuyan las Leyes. En virtud del principio de desarrollo sostenible
column13: las políticas para la regulación
column14: ordenación
column15: ocupación
column16: transformación y uso del suelo
column17: deben propiciar el uso racional de los recursos naturales armonizando los requerimientos de la economía
column18: el empleo
column19: la cohesión social
column20: la igualdad de trato y de oportunidades
column21: la salud y la seguridad de las personas y la protección del medio ambiente.La ordenación territorial y la urbanística son funciones públicas no susceptibles de transacción que organizan y definen el uso del territorio y del suelo de acuerdo con el interés general
column22: determinando las facultades y deberes del derecho de propiedad del suelo conforme al destino de éste. El ejercicio de la potestad de ordenación territorial y urbanística deberá ser motivado con expresión de los intereses generales a que sirve.

column1: LEX-FAOC060857;"Products of Animal Origin (Third Country Imports) (Wales) Regulations 2005 (W.S.I. No. 666 (W.56) of 2005).";"The products to which the Regulations apply (defined in regulation 2) must comply with the requirements listed
column2: by reference to the relevant Community legislation
column3: in Schedule 1. Trade samples and products intended for exhibition or study or analysis are exempt from the Regulations (regulation 3(1)). Products intended for personal use which comply with the conditions in regulation 3(3)
column4: are exempt from all but a few of the regulations. Regulations 4 and 16 define the authorities that enforce the Regulations. Regulations 7
column5: 8 and 9 confer the necessary enforcement powers. Part 3 establishes the inspection system which will apply to the generality of products. Parts 4 to 9 lay down special provisions which apply to particular categories of product (on-board catering supplies
column6: products intended for free circulation in the Community
column7: products in transit across Wales
column8: products intended for warehousing under particular customs regimes
column9: and products exported from the Community and then returned to it). Part 10 deals with the calculation and payment of charges for the veterinary checks. These Regulations provide for the use of the common veterinary entry document introduced by Commission Regulation (EC) No. 136/2004.

column1: LEX-FAOC100578;"Town and Country Planning (Modification and Discharge of Planning Obligations) (Scotland) Regulations 2010 (S.S.I. No. 432 of 2010).";"These Regulations make provision in connection with applications for the modification and discharge of planning obligations entered into under section 75 of the Town and Country Planning (Scotland) Act 1997 and related appeals.Section 75 stipulates that a planning obligation may not be modified or discharged except by agreement between the planning authority and a person against whom that obligation is enforceable. Where a planning authority does not undertake proper action or determines that a planning obligation is to continue to have effect without modification
column2: the applicant may appeal to the Scottish Ministers.

column1: LEX-FAOC034305;"European Communities (Control of Major Accidents Involving Dangerous Substances) Regulations
column2: 2000 (S.I. No. 476 of 2000).";"The purpose of these Regulations is to implement Council Directive 96/82/EC on the control of major accident hazards involving dangerous substances. The Regulations apply to establishments where dangerous substances are present in amounts equal to or exceeding the application thresholds. Operators of establishments are required to take all necessary measures to prevent the occurrence of major accidents and to limit the consequences of accidents for people and the environment. The Regulations impose duties in respect of safety management systems
column3: preparation of safety reports and emergency preparedness. The Regulations also deal with provision of advice on major hazards in the context of land-use planning decisions. The Regulations set out the arrangements for the appointment of competent authorities
column4: enforcement and the provision of information. The Regulations provide for the levying of charges by competent authorities for duties performed pursuant to these Regulations.

column1: Implements: Council Directive 96/82/EC on the control of major-accident hazards involving dangerous substances. (1996-12-09)

No. 433 of 2010).";"These Regulations make provision regarding an application for modification or discharge of an obligation entered into under a good neighbour agreement made pursuant to section 75D of the Town and Country Planning (Scotland) Act 1997 (as inserted by the Planning etc. (Scotland) Act 2006). The Regulations also apply the procedures contained in the Town and Country Planning (Appeals) (Scotland) Regulations 2008 to appeals made under section 75F
column2: which enables an applicant to appeal to the Scottish Ministers in certain circumstances. Section 76D allows a person
column3: by agreement with a community body
column4: to enter into an obligation governing operations or activities relating to the development or use of land
column5: either permanently or during such period as may be specified in the agreement.

column1: LEX-FAOC083797;"Small Enterprises Development Corporation Act [Chapter 24:12].";"This Act provides for the establishment of the Small Enterprises Development Corporation and the Small Enterprises Development Board
column2: defines powers and functions of the Corporation and provides for the functioning and financing of the Corporation.The functions of the Corporation shall be to: (a) encourage and assist in the establishment of cooperatives and small commercial or industrial enterprises; (b) provide financial assistance
column3: management counselling and training
column4: information
column5: advice or assistance to cooperatives and small commercial or industrial enterprises; (c) advise the Minister on all matters connected with cooperatives and small commercial or industrial enterprises. Loans or financial assistance may be granted by the Corporation on the security of land or registered real right.

column1: LEX-FAOC163002;"Philippine Development Program. Integrated Environmental and Social Safeguards Framework.";"The Philippine Rural Development Program (PRDP) is a six-year national government development platform with a multi-sectoral approach. It aims at contributing towards achieving an inclusive
column2: value-chain oriented
column3: and climate resilient agriculture and fisheries sector. It provides an operational Agriculture and Fisheries Modernization Plan (AFMP) for an integrated technical support service delivery at the local and national levels
column4: build strategic network of rural logistics infrastructure within priority value chains in targeted program areas
column5: strengthen and develop viable rural enterprises through efficient supply and value chain of key agricultural and fishery products in targeted program areas
column6: implement and model innovations towards more effective and efficient institutional support systems for programme implementation
column7: and institutionalize stakeholder engagement. The thrust of PRDP to develop a market-oriented and climate-resilient agriculture and fishery sector will be articulated through its four (4) components: i) Local and National Level Planning (I-PLAN)
column8: ii) Infrastructure Development (I-BUILD)
column9: iii) Enterprise Development (I-REAP) and
column10: iv) Project Implementation Support (I-SUPPORT).The document aims at making agriculture
column11: forestry and fisheries more productive and sustainable.The programme also enables more inclusive and efficient agricultural and food systems. The document recognizes that economically
column12: indigenous cultural communities are at a great disadvantage. Traditionally farmers
column13: hunters and fishers have very limited or no access to information and knowledge on sustainable agricultural practices
column14: inputs and technologies
column15: as well as improved plant stock and seeds. Therefore it provides for training
column16: empowerment and develops farmers’ skills in making critical and informed decisions towards a more productive
column17: profitable and sustainable crop production system. Measures on land acquisition are foreseen as well.The Provincial Program Management and Implementation Unit (PPMIU) shall provide direct supervision and monitoring of the implementation of and compliance with this Framework. As part of this responsibility the PPMIU shall submit monthly
column18: quarterly and annual reports.

column1: LEX-FAOC109140;"Common Land Use Planning Ordinance.";"The present Ordinance lays down provisions implementing land use planning regulations for the common area of Berlin-Brandenburg. The specific purpose of the Ordinance is to ensure the compatibility of land use planning with the requirements of a sustainable development keeping future generations in mind. Projects of land use planning shall be dealt with by the competent authority within 6 months. The text deals with the following issues: principles
column2: purpose
column3: sphere of application
column4: preparation
column5: documentation
column7: introduction and implementation of the proceedings
column8: duration of validity
column9: duty to report
column10: transitional provisions and entry into force. The text consists of 11 articles.

column1: LEX-FAOC006866;"Act LV of 1994 on Arable Land.";"The purpose of this Law is the establishment of market oriented conditions in the agricultural sector based on private ownership. Land transfer and the use of land as guarantee for land-based credit should promote the efficient operation of new businesses. This Law basically regulates the use of arable land and aims to create landed properties suitable for competitive agricultural production
column2: avoiding to burden land with the effects of excessive subdivision. The reduction of agricultural land should remain within reasonable limits and the conservation of land quality should have legal backing. In Chapter I introductory provisions regarding the effect of the Law and definition of terms are set forth. The Law applies to all arable land in the national territory
column3: to the utilization and conservation of land
column4: to the acquisition of landed property and its restrictions and to the creation of plots. The provisions apply to urban land
column5: whether under agricultural or forestry cultivation. Chapter II deals with the acquisition of ownership of arable land by Hungarian and foreign private persons or legal entities. EU citizens enjoy the same rights as Hungarians if they have been living and operating in the field of agriculture for at least 3 years in Hungary
column6: and if they meet certain requisites and undertake some obligations. The Law covers acquisition under any form except: legal inheritance
column7: adverse possession
column8: construction over others' property
column9: expropriation and through auction for compensation purposes. Use of arable lands is provided for in Chapter III. Use rights are regulated in the Civil Code as is the lease of arable land
column10: unless this Law provides otherwise. Chapter IV deals with procedures for the creation of estates (general land reform
column11: voluntary exchange of lands). Provisions on the utilization and protection of arable land are set forth in Chapter V. Cultivation profiles should be respected. Changes in cultivation profiles are to be authorized
column12: otherwise penalties are foreseen. In the light of these purposes
column13: soil conservation has an important role and aims to maintain the productivity and quality of the soil. Soil conservation is provided for in Chapter VI which sets forth State duties
column14: the obligations of land users and provides for soil conservation authorities and their duties. Soil conservation penalties shall be applied to offenders.

column1: LEX-FAOC020709;"Planning (Environmental Impact Assessment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1999 (S.R. No. 73 of 1999).";"These Regulations are concerned with the implementation in Northern Ireland of Council Directive 85/337/EC as amended by Council Directive 97/11/EC on the assessment of the effects of certain public and private developments on the environment. The main changes made by Directive 97/11/EC
column2: which these Regulations implement are increased coverage of the types of development requiring environmental impact assessment (EIA); a requirement for individual determinations; clarification of the way in which or whether EIA is required for every Annex II project exceeding the thresholds established by the Member States; a requirement to give advice on the content of the environmental statement if the developer so requests; a requirement to publicise the decision on the need for EIA and also the consent decision; a requirement to give reasons for decisions on granting or refusing consent; enhanced consultation arrangements with other Member States where projects are likely to have significant transboundary effects. The Regulations impose procedural requirements in connection with the consideration of applications for planning permission under the Planning (Northern Ireland) Order 1991 and applications for planning permission deemed to be made where an appeal is made against an enforcement notice.

column1: LEX-FAOC141979;"Décret n°8-177 P-P-RM du 27 mars 2008 fixant les modalités d'application de la loi relative au contrôle de qualité des engrais.";"Le présent décret fixe les modalités d'application de la Loi No 08-008 du 28 février 2008 relative au contrôle de qualité des engrais.Toute personne physique ou morale désireuse de produire
column2: d’importer ou de distribuer des engrais doit être enregistrée auprès de la Direction Nationale de l'Agriculture. A cet effet
column3: un arrêté du ministre de l’agriculture fixe les modalités et les conditions de l’enregistrement.Il prévoit également les pouvoirs des agents de contrôle et institue un comité national des engrais (CNE) chargé d’émettre des avis sur la réglementation relative aux engrais; proposer au Ministère chargé de l’agriculture toutes les mesures susceptibles de contribuer à la normalisation
column4: à la définition et à l'établissement des conditions et modalités de production et d'emploi d'engrais de qualité.Les normes de concentrations maximales autorisées des engrais en métaux lourds sont fixées par arrêté du Ministre chargé de l’agriculture.

column1: LEX-FAOC097939;"Regulation on the disposal of waste oils.";"This Regulation of the Government of the Republic of Slovenia
column2: which is composed of 27 articles
column3: establishes provisions concerning compulsory treatment in the disposal of waste oils
column4: conditions for collection of waste oils
column5: obligations related to the sale of motor oil for transport
column6: and reporting obligations to the European Commission. For the purposes of these provisions waste oil means mineral or synthetic oil in liquid or semi-liquid state
column7: which is no longer appropriate for the use for which it was intended . Waste oils are in particular: waste hydraulic oils
column8: waste motor
column9: engine and other lubricating oil
column10: waste oil or fluid for heat insulation or heat transfer
column11: scrap ship oil
column12: and other waste mineral or synthetic oil waste.

column1: LEX-FAOC151323;"Decreto Nº 2.365 - Suprime el Instituto Colombiano de Desarrollo Rural (INCODER).";"El presente Decreto suprime el Instituto Colombiano de Desarrollo Rural (INCODER)
column2: creado mediante el Decreto Nº 1.300 de 2003
column3: adscrito al Ministerio de Agricultura y Desarrollo Rural
column4: y ordena su liquidación. La entrega de los archivos del INCODER
column5: se hará a la Agencia Nacional de Tierras (ANT) y a la Agencia de Desarrollo Rural (ADR). Los contratos
column7: acuerdos y procesos de contratación en curso que
column8: por su objeto
column9: deban continuar ejecutándose se llevarán por parte de la ANT y por la ADR.El Plan Nacional de Desarrollo 2014-2018 “Todos por un nuevo país”
column10: dispone la necesidad de contar con un organismo institucional integral y multisectorial que tenga presencia territorial
column11: de acuerdo con las necesidades de los pobladores rurales y los atributos del territorio
column12: que permita corregir las brechas de bienestar y oportunidades de desarrollo entre regiones rurales; y faculta al Presidente de la República de facultades extraordinarias para: a) crear una entidad u organismo responsable de la administración de las tierras como recurso para el desarrollo rural
column13: de la política de acceso a tierras y la gestión de la seguridad jurídica para consolidar y proteger los derechos de propiedad en el campo; y b) crear una entidad responsable de gestionar
column14: promover y financiar el desarrollo rural y agropecuario con el fin de acercar al territorio la presencia institucional del orden nacional para la transformación del campo y adelantar programas con impacto regional.

column1: LEX-FAOC151321;"Decreto Nº 2.363 - Crea la Agencia Nacional de Tierras (ANT).";"El presente Decreto crea la Agencia Nacional de Tierras (ANT)

column3: patrimonio propio y autonomía administrativa
column4: técnica y financiera
column5: adscrita al Ministerio de Agricultura y Desarrollo Rural
column6: como máxima autoridad de las tierras de la nación en los temas de su competencia. La ANT
column7: como máxima autoridad de las tierras de la nación
column8: tendrá por objeto ejecutar la política de ordenamiento social de la propiedad rural formulada por el Ministerio de Agricultura y Desarrollo Rural
column9: para lo cual deberá gestionar el acceso a la tierra como factor productivo
column10: lograr la seguridad jurídica sobre esta

column13: la Superintendencia de Notariado y Registro

column21: con criterios de distribución equitativa entre los trabajadores rurales en condiciones que les asegure mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida; 8) otorgar el Subsidio Integral de Reforma Agraria; 9) administrar los bienes que pertenezcan al Fondo Nacional Agrario que sean o hayan sido transferidos a la ANT; 10) adelantar los procesos de adquisición directa de tierras en los casos establecidos en la ley; 11) administrar las tierras baldías de la nación

column23: delimitar y constituir reservas sobre éstas

column31: deslinde de tierras de la nación

column1: LEX-FAOC151320;"Decreto Nº 2.367 - Crea el Consejo Superior de la Administración de Ordenamiento del Suelo Rural.";"El presente Decreto crea el Consejo Superior de la Administración de Ordenamiento del Suelo Rural
column2: como un organismo del Gobierno nacional encargado de formular lineamientos generales de política
column3: y coordinar y articular la implementación de políticas públicas en materia de ordenamiento del suelo rural
column4: considerando factores ambientales
column5: sociales
column7: territoriales
column8: económicos y culturales.El Consejo Superior de la Administración de Ordenamiento del Suelo Rural se crea al amparo del Plan Nacional de Desarrollo 2014-2018
column9: que tiene como objetivo construir una sociedad en paz
column10: equitativa y educada
column11: a partir de un enfoque territorial y de cierre de brechas que contempla la necesidad de orientar las políticas públicas hacia la inclusión
column12: la promoción social y la construcción de escenarios con igualdad de oportunidades
column13: con una mirada multisectorial
column14: que atienda las necesidades de la población de forma integral y coordinada. El ordenamiento del suelo rural constituye un elemento para el desarrollo rural y agropecuario
column15: ambientalmente sostenible y multifactorial
column16: y debe garantizar la efectividad de la función social y ecológica de la propiedad
column17: la prevalencia del interés general sobre el particular
column18: y la distribución equitativa de las cargas y los beneficios. Por este motivo
column19: es preciso contar con lineamientos generales
column20: directrices
column21: criterios
column22: e instrumentos que permitan lograr un adecuado ordenamiento del suelo rural
column23: bajo una dimensión multisectorial.Son funciones del Consejo Superior de Ordenamiento del Suelo Rural: 1) actuar como instancia máxima en la asesoría
column24: coordinación en materias relacionadas con el ordenamiento y planeación del suelo rural; 2) servir de organismo coordinador entre las distintas instancias de gobierno nacional y facilitar la coordinación entre estas y las del nivel territorial
column25: y fijar las orientaciones generales que las instancias deben seguir para garantizar la efectividad de la función social y ecológica de la propiedad; 3) formular lineamientos generales para el ordenamiento y planeación del suelo rural; 4) fijar criterios que permitan reducir
column26: conciliar y resolver la problemática que se pueda presentar en las intervenciones que lleven a cabo las entidades públicas por el uso del suelo rural y la tenencia del mismo; 5) orientar y asegurar la articulación y coordinación de los procesos de catastro y registro de la propiedad rural
column27: impartiendo las directrices y los lineamientos a las entidades competentes en estas materias; 6) promover la adopción de los procesos
column28: metodologías
column31: jurídicos
column33: destinados a la implementación del catastro multipropósito como herramienta de apoyo para la toma de decisiones en materia de ordenamiento del suelo rural; 7) impartir lineamientos en el marco del Sistema Nacional de Gestión de Tierras que permitan la integración
column35: y articulación de los sistemas e información que administran las entidades
column36: y permitan un eficiente manejo de los recursos por parte de las entidades competentes en materia de tierras; 8) proponer y promover la adopción de incentivos para el adecuado ordenamiento y formalización del suelo rural.

It sets out the procedure of such inquiries and provides for appointment of an inspector and supporting officers for purposes of an inquiry. The inspector shall conduct the public inquiry as he or she thinks fit
column2: subject to the requirements of this Order and of the terms of reference.

column1: LEX-FAOC100374;"Planning and Building (General Development) (Jersey) Order 2008.";"This Order specifies permitted development for articles 8(3)(a) of the Planning and Building (Jersey) Law 2002. That provision empowers the Minister to grant
column2: by Order
column3: planning permission in respect of a class or classes of development specified in the Order. The Minister may give a direction that the permission shall not apply in respect of: (a) all or any development of the Part
column4: Class or paragraph; or (b) the change of use within the use class
column5: specified in the direction. Some development concerns agricultural land.

column1: LEX-FAOC115455;"Farms Act (No. 60 of 2007).";"This Act ensures sound and diversified use of agricultural property for agricultural production
column2: sustainable development of agricultural industries and improving the competitiveness of these industries; accommodates development in rural areas requiring these properties to be registered as a farm in Survey and Cadastre Authority's land register.The Act consists of 20 Chapters: Purpose (1); Definitions (2); Planning (3); Listed as farm (4); Termination or cancellation of farm duty (5); Residency requirement
column3: residential buildings
column4: vacant agricultural properties
column5: operations
column6: etc. (6); Individuals acquisition of agricultural property in rural areas (7); Societies
column7: acquisition of agricultural property in rural areas (9); Public authorities and foundations
column8: etc. acquisition of agricultural property or parts of farms (10; Variation of statutes or charter provisions (11); Interoperation and leases (12); Conversion of land between agricultural properties (13); Creating new independent farms (14); Priority for supplementing soil (15); Agricultural Commissions and their operation (16); Provisions on Administration of Law (17); Monitoring and Supervision (18); Penal Provisions (19); Entry into force and transitional provisions (20).

column1: LEX-FAOC084537;"Decision No. 865/QD-TTg approving the planning on construction of the northern coastal region up to 2025 with a vision to 2050.";"This Decision approves the planning on the construction of the northern coastal region.The planning aims at developing the northern coastal region into a general economic region and at building a wide system of infrastructure to facilitate economic development and environmental protection.The planning
column2: among other things
column3: shall include: land use planning; the protection of natural areas including low river basins
column4: flood drainage areas
column5: sea dykes
column7: biosphere reserves and agricultural areas; the protection of surface water and groundwater sources; the collection and treatment of solid waste; the protection of the environment and of the sea environment; and agricultural and rural development.

column1: LEX-FAOC163176;"Chattels Security Act
column2: 2014 (No. 7 of 2014).";"This Act concerns the creation
column3: perfection registration and sale of security interest and rights and obligations relating to chattels. It also concerns security interests in crops and animals. A perfected security interest in crops for new value given to enable a debtor produce the crops during the production season
column4: given not more than three months before the crops become growing crops takes priority over an earlier perfected security interest. An instrument may be granted over the crops described or referred to in the instrument
column5: which
column6: at the time of execution of the instrument are planted or growing upon the land mentioned in the instrument. An instrument shall not prejudicially affect the rights of a landlord or a mortgagee of any land on which crops comprised in the instrument are growing
column7: except where the landlord or mortgagee consents to the instrument in writing. The provisions of the Land Act
column8: Cap. 227 relating to family land rights shall apply to this Act.

column1: Repeals: Chattels Transfer Act 1978 (Cap. 70). column1: LEX-FAOC144679;"Implementing Rules of Rural Community Land Readjustment Act.";"The purpose of these Rules is to implement the Rural Community Land Readjustment Act. The Text consists of 39 Articles divided into 6 Chapters: General provisions (I); Selection and Determination of Readjustment Areas (II); Readjustment Encumbrance and Construction Work (III); Land Redistribution and Dispute Settlement(IV); Right Liquidation and Arrangement of Cadastration(V); Supplementary Provisions (VI).Article 3 sets up principles for the evaluation
column2: selection
column3: and determination of readjustment areas. The land valuation before and after the land readjustment
column4: shall be in accordance with the assessment provisions in Article 10.

column1: LEX-FAOC156381;"Regional Law No. 154-ZO “On land relations”.";"This Regional Law establishes plenary powers of the regional Legislative Assembly
column2: Governor
column3: Regional Government and authorized regional state executive body in the sphere of land relations. It also establishes maximum agricultural land area (150 ha) and minimum agricultural land area (0
column4: 5 ha) of public and municipal land that can be allotted in ownership for farming. The aforesaid plots of land can be allotted once-only. Lease of agricultural public land shall be authorized for three years and over with possibility of renewal subject to purposeful use of land by leaseholders and compliance with terms and conditions of lease contract.

column1: LEX-FAOC006356;"Decree No. 44 on the implementation of the Land Code of the Republic of Armenia.";"The Land Code of Armenia becomes effective on 15 March
column2: 1991 (art. 1). Only legislation which does not contradict provisions of the Code will apply (art. 2). The Land Code will apply to laws enacted- and rights and responsibilities arising after the Code comes into effect (arts. 3 and 4). The Council of Ministers shall
column3: prior to 15 March 1991
column4: propose to the Supreme Soviet the amendments ensuing from the Land Code of the legislation currently in force (art. 6). (6 articles)

column1: LEX-FAOC032794;"Regional Law No. 135-OZ on determination of the price of land within and outside settlements of the Kaluga Region in the process of selling the plots of land pertaining to state and municipal property to the owners of edifices
column2: constructions and works situated on them.";"The price of land within and outside settlements of the Kaluga Region in the process of selling the plots of land pertaining to state and municipal property to the owners of edifices
column3: constructions and works situated on them is fixed tenfold of land charges for a unit of area of a plot of land. In the process of selling a plot of land there must be applied correction factor to the price of the plot of land taking into account main use of edifices
column4: constructions and works situated on it in accordance with the legislation currently in force.

The revocation is consequential on regulation 5(36) of the Conservation (Natural Habitats
column2: c.) (Amendment) Regulations
column3: which inserts provision to similar effect as the revoked provision in regulation 64A of the 1994 Regulations.

column1: LEX-FAOC073047;"Ministerial Decree No. 273 validating the Regulation on supervision over land use planning.";"This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of organization and carrying out supervision over land use planning. The purpose of supervision shall be to enforce the observance technical norms and requirements by legal and natural persons in the process of land use planning. Federal Land Cadastre Service shall carry out supervision over: (a) observance of technical requirements in the process of land use planning; (b) rational land management and soil conservation; (c) implementation of injunctions of the administrative bodies to eliminate defects verified in the process of land use planning; and (d) transfer a copy of land use planning documentation free-of-charge to the state land use planning database.
Implements: Federal Law No. 78-FZ on land use planning. (2001-06-18)
Repealed by: Ministerial Decree No. 1061 validating the Regulation on supervision over land use planning. (2008-12-29)";"Gnetii

column1: LEX-FAOC160468;"Decree No. 301 of the Cabinet of Ministers “On land tenure or rural inhabited areas”.";"This Decree sets forth the modalities of land tenure of rural inhabited areas
column2: in particular establishing land-use planning guidelines related to residential construction and provision of urban amenities. Expropriation and allotment of land of rural inhabited areas shall be performed by decision of local government. Land tenure and development of rural inhabited areas shall be performed in conformity with land-use planning scheme.

column2: 0 ha on conditions of permanent (open-ended) land tenure through tenders for performance of entrepreneurial activities. column1: LEX-FAOC117280;"Law amending the Law on Soil Preservation and Land Utilization and the Law on pastures.";"This Law amends the Law No. 5403 on Soil Preservation and Land Utilization and the Law No. 4342 on pastures.This Law adds two new clauses (f) and (g) to Article. 13 of the Law No. 5403 on the use of agricultural lands other than agricultural purposes. The new clauses set forth agticultural lands may be used for renewable energy production purposes and geothermal greenhouse investments. The Law also repeals Provisional Article. 3 and adds a new provisional article to the above mentioned Law No. 5403. This Law further makes amendments in the Law No. 4342 by adding two new clauses to Article. 14 on changes in the purpose of the allocation of pasture lands. The new clauses (ğ) and (h) set out that
column2: pasture lands allocated for the purpose of grazing and nomadic transhumance may be reallocated for renewable energy production purposes and geothermal greenhouse investments.

column1: Amends: Law on pastures No. 4342. (1998-02-25)
